title: Client Services Administrator
description:
**Summary**

Organization/Business Overview:
  

Sandlapper Group is an independent financial services practice of Thrivent Financial. We take a broad-based approach to helping our members achieve multiple financial goals. Sandlapper Group helps our members analyze their current situation, develop in-depth financial programs, and help them implement an integrated financial strategy.
  

  

Thrivent Investment Management Inc. is a FINRA and SIPC member and a wholly owned subsidiary of Thrivent Financial. Thrivent Financial is a faith-based, not-for-profit financial services organization with approximately 2.6 million members. As the nation's largest fraternal benefit society, we're here solely to help others. We help every day through the financial solutions we offer, the member activities we support, and the resources we provide to the Christian community and nonprofit organizations.
  

  

Position summary:
  

This position provides securities licensed administrative support to Sandlapper Group. This position serves as a resource to Financial Advisors and client/members in handling, researching and communicating inquiries regarding their accounts and supports the daily operations of the practice, including, but not limited to: answering the phones, meeting/greeting members, handling/distributing postal mail and practice email, ordering supplies, utilizing Thrivent Financial computer systems and programs in support of client relations, supporting securities related tasks, and other administrative tasks as assigned. The Client Service Administrator reports to and is employed by the Financial Advisor.
  

  

This position can be either full time or part time in hours. Compensation ranges from $22-26/hr depending upon licensing and experience.
  

  

FINRA Securities Licensing required for this position.
**Job Description**

**Position Roles/Responsibilities/Accountabilities**

* Researches inquiries regarding customer/member accounts
* Provides fund values and answers other securities (including, if appropriately licensed, variable insurance and annuities) product-related questions and/or questions related to investment advisory services
* Prepares or coordinates the preparation of routine correspondence, reports, and special projects of a routine nature
* Supports projects, administration of various programs, and processing functions as needed
* Drive customer/member facing activity in the practice by scheduling meetings with customer/members on behalf of the practice’s Financial Advisors
* Updates the contact management system with customer/member contact and preference information
* Assist Financial Advisors in the preparation and follow up for the customer/member meetings
* Collaborate with financial associates to assist customer/member to purchase, sell, hold or exchange securities products
* Verbal or written communications with prospective or existing customers regarding financial matters
* Conducting substantive research or information gathering that will be used with making securities product recommendations or providing investment advice (e.g. conducting due diligence, etc.)
* Obtaining customer financial and/or suitability information
* Accepting and/or entering securities trade orders from customers, including unsolicited trade orders
* Support questions and transactions with variable insurance and annuities products, if appropriately licensed
* Additional responsibilities may be assigned in accordance with licensure and business needs

**Position Qualifications**

* Previous administrative/secretarial experience desired
* Must be securities registered (i.e. 7 & 66 or 6 & 63).
* Must be securities registered in all states in which the candidate would be doing support work for Sandlapper Group
* Demonstrated customer service orientation/experience, 2+ years preferred
* Strong technical computer aptitude and knowledge of business tools (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint) or ability to learn
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and maintain a high quality of work while experiencing frequent interruptions
* Ability to maintain integrity of sensitive/confidential information
* Basic understanding of Sandlapper Group, our products and services, and Thrivent Financial

**Competencies**

* Planning/Organizing
* Customer Focus
* Communication
* Interpersonal Skills
* Teamwork and Collaboration
* Adaptability/Flexibility

**External/Internal Dependencies**

* Must be able to work with all roles of the Sandlapper Group
* Must be able to represent the organization in work with external clients
* Must be able to cultivate and maintain relationships with outside organizations

As part of Sandlapper Group’s recruiting/hiring/contracting process, a verification of a candidate's background will be made to complete the process. Fingerprints will be required as part of FINRA registration process for submission to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for review against nationwide fingerprint records.


*All persons with securities registrations are subject to TIMI’s Outside Securities Accounts Policy which requires all outside brokerage accounts to be maintained at one of the firms designated by TIMI.*

title: Network and Computer Systems Administrator, Jr
description:
Position: Network and Systems Administrator, Jr



Location: Fully Remote



We are seeking an inquisitive and aspiring individual to join our team as a Junior Network and Computer System Administrator. In this role, you'll be providing support for our Azure cloud network infrastructure and computer systems to ensure they are operating efficiently and securely.


Responsibilities:


* Install, configure, and maintain network hardware and software using Microsoft Azure Cloud. Work towards automating the process using PowerShell or Python
* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise
* Set up and maintain user accounts and permissions
* Provide user support for employee laptops and various software applications
* Implement security measures to protect the network and computer systems
* Perform regular backups and ensure data integrity
* Review security audit logs
* Respond to client system security questionnaires
* Collaborate with other IT team members to implement new technologies and projects
* Stay current on industry trends and best practices in network administration


Minimum Qualifications:


* Either
	+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
	+ Relevant certifications (e.g. CompTIA Network+, CCNA) and 2+ years of related experience
	+ 4+ years of related experience
* Strong understanding of network protocols and technologies
* Experience with configuring and managing network devices, such as routers, switches, and firewalls
* Knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


If you are a proactive individual with a passion for technology and a desire to grow in the field of network and computer system administration, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer transparent compensation and benefits, as well as opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.



Starting compensation for this position is $63,190.00/year + discretionary bonus dependent on the company performance.  

  

Benefits include:


* Unlimited Paid Time Off (25 days minimum)
* 9 Holidays
* Medical Insurance through Blue Cross Blue Shield
* Dental Insurance through Guardian
* Vision Insurance through VSP
* 401K through Slavic401K with 4% match and immediately vested
* Employer paid Short Term disability
* Employer paid Life and AD&D Insurance

title: System Administrator - Seventy-Five Percent Travel Required
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a skilled and experienced System Administrator to join our IT team. This role is unique in that it involves heavy travel, as our projects span various locations and require on-site support. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to adapt to different environments.


**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Provide on-site system administration and support for clients across multiple locations.
* Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software components of IT systems.
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their IT needs and tailor solutions accordingly.
* Manage and maintain documentation related to system configurations, processes, and procedures.
* Collaborate with remote and on-site teams to address IT challenges and implement improvements.

**What Required Skills You'll Bring:**

* Proven experience as a System Administrator or similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of operating systems, network protocols, and system security.
* Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to analyze and resolve complex issues.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to travel extensively to client sites (up to 75% travel). Travel is three weeks out of the month within the United States.  
* 

  

**What Desired Skills You'll Bring:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Relevant certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA), or equivalent.
* Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V).
* Experience with Building Automation and Control Systems is a plus
* Experience with DoD Systems is a plus
* DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 certifications minimum, Level 3 preferred.

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.
Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.
Salary Range:


$46.35 - $81.11
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Intune Administrator (m/f/d)
description:
The European Technology Chamber is a registered NGO that enables European companies to use their technologies for the benefit of Europe and mankind - following our vision "Technology obliges". As Europe’s leading tech network, we are constantly enlarging our team to serve our network even better.



We are currently building our team and now searching for


**Intune Administrator** **(m/f/d) - 100% Remote**


**Your Mission:**



We are looking for an experienced Intune Administrator who possesses a deep understanding of Microsoft Intune and its extensive capabilities. The ideal candidate will be adept at managing and configuring Intune to meet the organization's requirements effectively. Additionally, proficiency in packaging applications and deploying them through Intune is crucial for this role.


**Your daily tasks:**


* Serve as the primary administrator for Microsoft Intune, responsible for managing and maintaining Intune infrastructure and configurations.
* Design, implement, and enforce Intune policies for device management, compliance, security, and application management.
* Package applications efficiently and effectively for deployment through Intune, ensuring compatibility and seamless integration with existing systems.
* Oversee the enrollment process of devices into Intune, including provisioning, registration, and configuration.
* Implement security measures within Intune to safeguard organizational data and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to resolve issues related to Intune configurations, policies, and deployments.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of Intune configurations, processes, and procedures to facilitate knowledge transfer and ensure continuity.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and application development, to align Intune configurations and deployments with organizational goals and requirements.
* Stay updated with the latest Intune features, enhancements, and best practices, and recommend improvements to optimize Intune utilization and performance.

  


**What we are looking for:**


* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Extensive experience in administering Microsoft Intune, including configuration, policy management, and troubleshooting.
* Proficiency in packaging applications for deployment through Intune, utilizing tools such as Microsoft Intune Management Extension (IME) or Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager.
* Strong understanding of mobile device management (MDM) concepts, including device enrollment, compliance policies, and remote wipe capabilities.
* Familiarity with Microsoft 365 suite, including Entra ID and Microsoft Endpoint Manager.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues promptly.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
+ Proven ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment

* Microsoft Intune certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Intune and Azure Administrator Associate).
* Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation and customization tasks.
* Knowledge of modern management technologies such as Windows Autopilot and co-management with Configuration Manager (CoM).

  


**We offer:**



We stand for the vision of a better and more sustainable world - hand in hand with European technology companies. With the personalities who are active in our organization worldwide, you create a great network and inspiration for your daily work - also for your personal future. So you get the chance to grow with us and the whole EU Tech Chamber.

title: Azure Cloud Administrator
description:
**Azure Cloud Administrator**

Job Summary:

Shared Logic is a software technology company that provides application software to all the major recycling companies. We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Azure Cloud Administrator to manage our cloud infrastructure, ensuring that it is secure, scalable, and efficient. As an Azure Cloud Administrator, you will be responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of our cloud-based applications, ensuring maximum uptime and optimal performance.

Key Responsibilities:

* Design, deploy and maintain cloud-based infrastructure, including compute, database, and network resources.
* Manage and monitor the Azure cloud platform, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and security.
* Design and implement automation and monitoring tools to ensure efficient and effective cloud operation.
* Develop and implement security protocols to protect the cloud infrastructure and applications from security threats.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure, applications, and services.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy new applications and services on the cloud platform.
* Develop and implement disaster recovery plans and strategies to ensure business continuity.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and best practices.
* Transition internal servers to cloud solutions.

Requirements:

* At least 2-3 years of experience in Azure cloud administration, preferably in the software industry.
* Strong experience in deploying, configuring, and managing Azure cloud infrastructure, including virtual machines, storage, and networking.
* Experience with automation and monitoring tools, such as PowerShell, Azure Automation, Azure Application Insights and Azure Monitor.
* Strong knowledge of cloud security protocols and best practices.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field.

If you are a highly motivated and experienced Azure Cloud Administrator with a passion for managing cloud infrastructure for software applications, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Shared Logic. We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and a challenging and rewarding work environment. Join our team and help us make a difference in the recycling industry!

You can find out more about us at www.sharedlogic.com

Interested candidates send **resume and salary requirements.**

PLEASE - NO PHONE CALLS FROM CANDIDATES OR RECRUITERS

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Title - Systems Administrator** 

**W2 only**

**Location – Remote**

**Green Card/US Citizen** 

**Description:**

As a Systems Administrator you will work independently, with your peers, and with our software vendors to translate customer needs into technical solutions for our Finance and Actuarial team. You will be responsible for the control of the technical configuration of technical vendor assets (primarily focused on tax and GRC platforms) by applying processes for documentation, change control management, reconfiguration, baselining, data management, and other relevant processes. You will manage and modify the elements that comprise information produced as a part of the software vendor process. You will be responsible for understanding vendor capabilities to best leverage the technology we have to deliver on our business objectives. This includes understanding vendor upgrades for impacts, configuring the system to deliver value, and maintaining certificates.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

Technical Configuration

* Ability to support configuration via software and/or scripting
* Contributes to the design and configuration of systems
* Ability to do data analysis within the platform, as needed
* Ability to support reports and analytics
* Ability to work / problem solve collaboratively & independently
* Follow, maintain, and may create processes, procedures, and documentation
* Strong working knowledge of systems/platform configuration

**Managing Technology Vendors**

* Ability to understand a vendor platform to be able to support configuration via software and/or scripting
* Ability to identify vendor release impacts and support release validation
* Participate in proof of concept / technology with the vendor (ex SOW process)
* Ability to support user provisioning and user account management (systematic or manual)
* Works collaborative with technology vendors to address system/platform and business needs

**Collaborating within the team**

* Participate in and may lead teams collaboration session to provide technical expertise to solve problem/remove roadblock
* Participate in and may lead product and release planning to help decompose work

**Collaboration outside the team:**

* Networks outside of the team to grow skills
* Bring awareness to their role across key stakeholders
* Actively working to learn how their role fits within the larger Thrivent ecosystem
* Participates in team support rotation, if applicable

**Coaching Others**

* May provide guidance to junior team members to help them learn foundational configuration skills

**Building Talent**

* Seeks to grow themselves through experiences and learning opportunities and share back with the team when applicable
* Contributes to an environment in which Thrivent employees and colleagues are focused on continuous improvement, exceptional employee engagement, and an unwavering commitment to our clients.
* Shapes and supports a culture that represents the Thrivent purpose, promise, values, ensuring that Thrivent's trust and reputation remain strong with its clients
* Models Thrivent's Leadership Competencies

**Technical Acumen**

* May have understanding of basic principles of Dev Ops to be able to make recommendations / implement Dev Ops for vendor packages
* Understanding of basic engineering and/or software development principles and terminology
* Understanding of common IT controls and processes (change management etc.)
* Understanding of common operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.) and proficiency in at least one operating system
* Basic understanding of common technical protocols, constructs, and concepts including but not limited to: basic networking and networking protocols, servers, storage, databases, application hosting platforms, cloud computing, and common application development tooling
* Understanding and familiarity of common security concepts, practices, and tools

**General**

* Understand and apply system & platform policies, standards, and processes to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability to Thrivent
* Assess and interpret policies and procedures and relevant business and technology processes
* Identify and recommend process improvements to streamline and enhance technology solutions
* Understand potential technology risks and respond appropriately
* Provide assistance with other deployed technologies, as needed
* Support regulatory examinations and internal audits, as needed
* Provide on call support of deployed technologies, as needed

**Required:**

* Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) platform support
* Server Configuration - Linux and Windows
* Security configuration and identify management integration
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in computer science, information security, business, mathematics or related field
* 3+ years of applicable experience
* Demonstrated leadership on small-mid scale projects impacting strategic priorities

Preferred:

* SAI Bwise, ServiceNow GRC platform and administration experience
* Strong Knowledge of Networking Protocols, Single Sign On, entitlement provisioning, and virtualization technologies.
* Test Data Maintenance and masking knowledge
* Diagnose, troubleshoot & perform repairs on responsible technologies
* Knowledge and proficient in the following technologies a plus: Java, mainframe

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

Work Location: Remote

title: LMI Database Administrator/Provisioner (Remote)
description:
**Description**


**Join a team committed to a mission!**

  

  

  

  

**At Leidos**, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

**Are you ready for your next career challenge?**


The Leidos National Security Sector has an opening for an LMI Database Administrator/Provisioner. This position is an exciting opportunity to support the Indirect Fire Protection Capability Program.

**Are you ready to unleash your potential?**

**Leidos National Security Sector** provides a diverse portfolio of systems, solutions, and services covering land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace for customers worldwide. Solutions for Defense include enterprise and mission IT, large-scale intelligence systems, command and control, geospatial and data analytics, cybersecurity, logistics, training, and intelligence analysis and operations support. Our team is solving the world’s toughest security challenges for customers with “can’t fail” missions. To explore and learn more, click here!

**Are you ready to make an impact? Begin your journey of a flourishing and meaningful career, share your resume with us today!**

**Responsibilities –** Work you’ll do:

**Are you ready to unleash your potential?**

**Leidos National Security Sector** provides a diverse portfolio of systems, solutions, and services covering land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace for customers worldwide. Solutions for Defense include enterprise and mission IT, large-scale intelligence systems, command and control, geospatial and data analytics, cybersecurity, logistics, training, and intelligence analysis and operations support. Our team is solving the world’s toughest security challenges for customers with “can’t fail” missions. To explore and learn more, click here!

**Are you ready to make an impact? Begin your journey of a flourishing and meaningful career, share your resume with us today!**

**Responsibilities –** Work you’ll do:

* Can perform logistics analysis using engineering drawings.
* Produce the LCN and PLISN architecture.
* Maintains relational data tables across all LSAR requirements.
* Has significant knowledge of the relationships between the "X" Tables and the "H" Tables.
* Develops CSV import templates unique to each LSAR deliverable.
* Develops the following studies: DLA Screen Data, Provisioning Parts List, EDFP, COIEL, BII, RPSTL, IPB's and Packaging Data.
* Will prepare for and take part in system test planning and execution, verification, and validation events as required.
* Plan and host Provisioning Guidance Conference (PGC)
* The candidate will provide direct support to the Leidos ILS Manager on all technical logistics efforts, integration with the systems engineering process and team, and attend all scheduled meetings as required.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Education:**

* BA/BS with 4+ years of relative experience, or MA/MS with 2+ years of relative experience. Additional experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.
* Experienced Knowledge of Powerlog J LMI Database
* Very good understanding of GEIA-0007C and DED requirements
* Very good understanding of SAE-TB-0007-1 and LSAR CSV Imports
* Excellent written communication skills
* Ability to understand and interpret engineer drawings
* Ability to perform logistics analyses for DoD programs.

**Preferred Experience, Skills, and Education – Favorable if you have:**

* DoD Systems Acquisition and Development Experience
* Integrated Logistics Support Experience
* Active Secret Clearance

**Clearance Required:**

* Must be eligible to obtain an Interim DoD Secret clearance within 120 days after hire date.

**At Leidos, the opportunities are boundless. We inspire our staff with interesting assignments that allow them to thrive professionally and personally. For us, helping you grow your career is good business. We look forward to learning more about you – apply today!**


EIO2024

2024-03-05

title: Operations Systems Administrator 2
description:
**Overview:** This position is responsible for researching, evaluating, installing, operating and maintaining IT Infrastructure, enterprise applications and telecommunications systems. Advanced knowledge of IBM I and Windows Operating systems is required. Systems Operations experience including job monitoring and scheduling, access management and system maintenance are required. Must also be experienced with vendor and service provider management and ensuring proper delivery of the services. Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to managing project activities, analysis and remediation of security issues, execution of disaster recovery plans and availability for the execution of off-hours maintenance.

**Job Duties**

1. Administers and monitors Enterprise Applications as well as related infrastructure and systems required to maintain appropriate levels of performance and availability. Designs, develops, installs and tests application and Operating System upgrades, patches and enhancements.

2.Creates system documentation, including system configurations, operational procedures and training materials. Implements and maintains proper documentation, such as a runbook, of Production processes necessary to identify and escalate failures or degraded services.

3. Implements, maintains and monitors system schedules and processes, including those on IBM i and Windows servers.

4. Develops, deploys and maintains system to system communications and data exchange orchestration including related software, access control, logging, protocols, hardware and vendors.

5. Takes ownership of system problems by leveraging in-house tools, vendors and support organizations while communicating and coordinating with company staff and management. Provides user, business-partner and vendor support and also communicates and escalates issues according to established processes.

6. Performs technology reviews to ensure that systems, applications and services satisfy business requirements and resolves any identified deficiencies. Reviews and analyzes existing applications’ effectiveness and efficiency, and then develops strategies for improving or leveraging these systems and increase user adoption

7. Designs, implements, tests and executes backup and recovery routines and monitors and administers the related tools to ensure the Business Continuity requirements are satisfied.

8. Directly involved with the identification, negotiation and management of vendors, service providers and related contracts as well as budget planning. Assist with feasibility studies and proof of concept exercises for services, software and related products being considered.

9. Participates in the change management process by assessing, monitoring and executing changes and promotions

**Prerequisites for the Job**

* 3-5 years IT systems and application administration and support, with extensive experience implementing enterprise-class technology solutions.
* Advanced knowledge of IBM i operating system sufficient to install, configure, implement, and administer systems/applications loaded thereon.
* Minimum 2-3 years experience as a system operator .
* Experience with Microsoft Operating System administration
* Ability to analyze a concept and devise an implementation plan utilizing all resources both internal and external
* Proficiency in oral and written English language communication
* Willingness to work cooperatively with others
* Physical and mental requirements for General Personnel

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $36.74 - $45.93 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account

* 5 years

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* implementing enterprise - technology solutions: 3 years (Required)
* system operator: 3 years (Required)

title: IDMS Active Directory (AD) Engineer
description:
**Responsibilities:**
**SUMMARY**
DIGIT is seeking an **Identity and Directory Management Services (IDMS) Active Directory (AD) Engineer** to support the design, administration, management, execution & maintenance of GSA’s Identity & Directory Management Services (IDMS) and Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) solutions to meet the needs of the enterprise users & the enterprise architecture. These services, systems, and capabilities include, but not limited to, directory services management, ICAM, privileged account management, Single Sign-On (SSO), Active Directory (AD) Domain Name System (DNS) services, Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), auditing and log management, Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation/Dynamic and Evolving Federal Enterprise Network Defense (CDM/DEFEND), and the management of appliances. GSA IT currently leverages Microsoft (MS) AD as the authoritative account management system.
As a leading provider of advanced information technology solutions and professional services to U.S. federal government agencies, is the prime for a $807m task order in support of the General Services Administration (GSA) Office of Digital Infrastructure Technologies (IDT) DIGIT (Digital Innovation for GSA Infrastructure Technologies) task order driving digital transformation and delivering continuous improvement and business value to its customers. The team is comprised of the best-in-class technology partners to leverage forward-leaning technologies and best practices to transform GSA’s IT capabilities and shift offerings to provide a more flexible service delivery model, completing the agency’s shift to a fully digital experience along with its adoption of advanced, emerging technologies such as intelligent automation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
This position shall perform the following (to include but not limited to) activities:
* Active Directory including but not limited to:
	+ Microsoft Active Directory
	+ Azure Active Directory
	+ NetIQ DRA
	+ NetIQ Group Policy Administrator (GPA)
	+ Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services
	+ Vulnerability Mitigation
* Hands-on experience with cloud computing services (O365/Microsoft Azure/AWS).
* Experience with network architecture.
* Powershell, java and .NET scripting.
* An understanding of Zero Trust concepts.
* Strong experience with Directories, SSO, Federation, Delegated administration, API gateways, SOA services.
* Monitoring and maintaining the Service Now ticketing system
* Strong communication skills with customers over phone, email, or ticketing system.
* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.
* Providing on-call rotation support on a routine basis.

  

**Qualifications:**
**CONTRACT REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
This following are REQUIRED for this position:
* Public Trust Clearance by start date.


* ITILv4 Foundation Training and ITILv4 Foundation Certification, may be obtained within 120 days after hire.


* Expertise in Powershell, java and .NET scripting.


* Considered Senior Active Directory Engineer.


* Applies fundamental concepts, processes, practices, and procedures on technical assignments. Performs work that requires practical experience and training. Work is performed under supervision.


* Proven ability to work independently in a full and/or partial remote environment with limited supervision and may supervise/lead others.


* Possess the ability to communicate in both oral and written forms, demonstrating an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as clients.


* Maintain standard working hours per the DIGIT contract and to be available for meetings, and other collaborative efforts during working hours.


* Demonstrated ability to apply comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments with the ability to use practical experience and training to determine how to accomplish tasks.


**CONTRACT DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
The following are DESIRED for this position:
Strong knowledge of the different identity and access management (IAM) concepts, technologies and authentication protocols.
* Public Key Infrastructure (PKI):
	+ Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS).
	+ HID Credential Management System (CMS).
	+ HID ActivClient.
	+ Federal PIV/CAC.
	+ Safenet Hardware Security Module (HSM’s).
* Identity Management services operations including but not limited to
	+ SailPoint IdentityIQ
	+ SecureAuth
	+ SAML 2.0
	+ Forefront Identity Manager/Microsoft Identity Manager
	+ Active Directory Federation Services
* Proficiency in the Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Chat, Meet, Docs, Slides, Sheets), Slack, and ServiceNow.


* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**
The following are the education and experience required for this position:
- 7 - 12 years of experience and bachelor's degree
* Experience as a remote worker demonstrating time management and self discipline with cultural change management and Agile mindset.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Summary:** Under general supervision and with independent judgment, develops and maintains large computer applications/systems, including enterprise applications. Ensures assigned systems are working properly, evaluates application/system performance to maintain standards, investigates and resolves complex software and hardware problems of users by performing the following duties.
  
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

1. Following defined processes, performs daily monitoring of applications/systems and enterprise systems (such as Active Directory, Imaging, E-mail, Thunderhead, Guidewire, and Peoplesoft), verifying the integrity and availability of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure.
  
  

a. Installs, updates, configures and monitors application/systems, working with other IT teams to ensure appropriate groups and security rights exist
  
b. Ensures enterprise consistency and integration where appropriate
  
c. Using problem management procedures, investigates and resolves software and hardware problems, handling problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up
  
d. Coordinates and manages scheduled maintenance and unscheduled outages
  
e. Prepares standard statistical reports
  
f. Creates application documentation as necessary
  
  

2. Ensures timely resolution of problem issues in accordance with customer expectations and procedural documentation.
  
a. Provides support and assistance to peers during problem resolutions situations, at times after normal business hours
  
b. Leads crisis calls and coordinates efforts with other IT groups
  
c. Provides status updates to users, supervisors, and management regarding problem resolution efforts.
  
d. Documents all solutions and communications
  
e. Works with vendors to resolve hardware and software issues while keeping supervisor and other Help Desk staff informed on progress
  
  

3. Acts as liaison between IT and business units for assigned applications/systems.
  
a. Provides technical direction to business units
  
b. May coordinate and execute basic training for new employees on computer hardware, software, and security.
  
c. Works with appropriate IT groups to meet business unit needs
  
  

4. Responsible for maintaining application licensing compliance.
  
a. Coordinates licensing programs with vendors
  
b. Prepares budget information
  
  

5. Develops defined processes for application support, using standard template
  
a. Ensures process are maintained and updated
  
  

6. Serves as a contributing member of project teams, or leader of project teams, coordinating resources to ensure achievement of project activities.
  
  

7. Perform other duties as assigned.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

**Education/Experience:**  

**Level 5:** Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or four to six years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
  

A minimum requirement for this position is the ability to work legally in the United States. No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

title: Application System Administrator
description:
**Our Purpose**

Bringing Friends and Families Together, Over Delicious Food, Served From the Heart

**Our Mission**

· Build an Amazing Workplace

· Create Customers for Life

· Become Franchisor of Choice

**Position Overview**

The Application System Administrator will lead, manage, and support critical business applications to ensure good performance, research, and resolve production issues including working with the application vendors technical support as needed. This role will have responsibility for multiple store operational systems including CrunchTime back-office software, online ordering and 3rd party delivery systems that support our restaurant operation’s needs. This role will interact daily with internal customers to make sure their needs are being met.

The Application System Administrator will also be responsible for documenting system configurations, job processes, program modifications and system procedures across all systems. Additionally, the Application System Administrator will lead new software installations, system testing, configuration changes and updates, as well as a variety of application troubleshooting. This role will report to the Director, Restaurant Technology.

**Responsibilities Include:**

· Perform configuration, administration, deployment, integration, and tuning of software application systems

· Perform assessment of product enhancements and determine the benefit and impact of vendor changes to the software products

· Document procedures for resolving issues in the most efficient way

· Make recommendations to department and operations leadership on process improvement and effective use of the products by operations

· Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance on software application-related issues

· Coordinate with customers and application vendors on technical issues, estimate time to resolution and provide updates to concerned parties during issue resolution

· Communicate effectively with customers on problems and resolution steps and status

· Open and/or close work orders as needed

· Maintain system security (user accounts, responsibilities, passwords, etc…)

· Assist quality assurance in validating changes and perform testing as needed

· Responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects

· Have a high level of computer security awareness

· Other duties, as assigned

**Qualifications and Skills:**

· Ability to think independently, negotiate with grace and stay focused

· Capacity to communicate clearly with presence

· Strong verbal and written communication skills are mandatory

· Flexibility in the face of shifting priorities

· Ability to prioritize, manage, and complete multiple tasks/projects

· Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

**Education and Experience**

· Associate’s or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

· 3-5 years of experience successfully supporting business applications, to include end user support, administration, maintenance, and upgrades

· Knowledge and experience with POS and back-office software, online ordering, and 3rd party delivery systems

· Solid understanding of core Microsoft technologies

· Working knowledge of restaurant operations

**Preferred Experience**

· Experience with restaurant back-office systems such as CrunchTime or Altametrics eRestaurant

· Knowledge and experience with MS SQL Server

**Disclaimer**

This position description is not intended, and should not be considered to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, effort or working conditions associated with the job. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of those principal job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, personal development, and compensation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,647.08 - $81,467.45 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Performance bonus
* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Associate Salesforce Administrator
description:
Location: **Remote**
  

Job Code: **24-026**
  

# of Openings: **3**  


**Description**
===============

  

At Technatomy, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We provide solutions to agencies and entities including Veterans Affairs, Department of Defense, Defense Logistics Agency, and National Institute of Health, and more. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.



 If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!



Our Associate Salesforce Administrator will play a crucial role in optimizing and maintaining the Salesforce platform for the Department of Veterans Affairs. You will work closely with other administrators, developers, architects, business stakeholders, and end-users to understand requirements, implement changes, and ensure the smooth operation of Salesforce systems. This role offers an excellent opportunity for learning and growth in Salesforce administration and business process management. The successful candidate will have a basic understanding of Salesforce functionalities, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate with various stakeholders. We're seeking Salesforce team members to help modernize and enhance enterprise system that connects healthcare providers directly with millions of US veterans seeking care.



**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**



* Provide frontline support to Salesforce users, addressing inquiries, troubleshooting issues, and resolving user-reported problems.
* Assist in configuring Salesforce objects, fields, workflows, validation rules, and other system components to meet business requirements.
* Collaborate with other administrators and developers to implement customizations, integrations, and enhancements.
* Support data cleansing, deduplication, and migration activities to ensure data accuracy and integrity within Salesforce.
* Assist in creating and maintaining data reports, dashboards, and views to support business analytics and decision-making.
* Perform routine system maintenance tasks, including user provisioning, profile management, and permission set assignments.
* Monitor system performance, security, and compliance, addressing any issues or concerns as they arise.
* Document Salesforce configurations, processes, and procedures to maintain an up-to-date knowledge base.
* Stay informed about Salesforce updates, new features, and best practices, sharing insights with the team to drive continuous improvement.

 **KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS** **REQUIRED****:**



* Basic understanding of Salesforce platform fundamentals, including data model, security model, and declarative customization options.
* Familiarity with Salesforce Lightning Experience and related technologies.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of Salesforce administration and technology.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 **KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS DESIRED:**



* Salesforce Administrator certification preferred, or willingness to obtain certification.
* Experience working with Federal agencies is a plus.

 **EDUCATION:**



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field.

 **CLEARANCE:**



* Must be a US Citizen.
* Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust clearance.

 **WORK LOCATION:**



* Remote
**Technatomy** **Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of** **Technatomy** **Corporation to afford equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, disability or veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.**

title: Sr. Project Online Administrator (MBI Required)
description:
**Responsibilities:**

Provide Microsoft 365 (M365) core program oversight and support Program Management Office activities at the Enterprise level across the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), which consists of 28 Business Units (BUs) and Information Technology (IT) Organizations. M365 enterprise is a cloud-powered productivity platform that preserves and shares information across the IRS using MS Exchange Servers, MS Teams, OneDrive for Business (ODB), SharePoint Online (SPO), Project Online (PJO), and Power Platforms (PP) tools.

The Increase Reduction Act New Hire (IRA-NH) signed by Congress August 16, 2022, mandates the IRS to improve the taxpayer experience and compliance. This M365 task order will ensure that the M365 tools are in place to provide the taxpayers with the ability to navigate the IRS systems with ease and to ensure taxpayer compliance.

**Job Description:**

The Contractor shall provide Project Online Administration to its features and functionality for the M365 business cloud systems and applications. Oversee and execute tasks pertaining to the maintenance and administration of the IRS Enterprise.

**Job Requirements:**

* Analyze technical requirements and develop effective technical solutions.
* Perform access management to project online functions.
* Assist with developing solutions for business process automation.
* Provide support and guidance to users on Project Online features and functionalities.
* Provide quality assurance review of engagement processes and deliverables as requested.
* Identify and troubleshoot technical issues, provide support to the system’s end-users, and work with development teams to find ways to modify or improve storage procedures.
* Assist with developing new workflows, appropriate views, and templates to support customer requirements.
* Regularly interface with senior management, stakeholders, implementation team members, Contractors, and subcontractors. Contractor shall provide insight on project status, business requirements, functional design, and remediation of risks/issues to avoid loss of business functionality during migration efforts.
* Provide bi-weekly status reports that encompasses schedule, M365 deliverables for each tool, action items, risks, mitigations, escalations, accomplishments, and closures.

**Required Skills:**

•Contractor shall have a minimum 5 years’ experience supporting Microsoft 365 (M365) Cloud Based Suite in a large corporate/government environment.

•Contractor shall have excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technologies and technical business concepts to multiple audiences.

•Contractor shall establish and maintain effective business unit relationships.

**Desired Outcome:**

The Contractor shall provide successful Project Online administration skills to the M365 Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure successful migrations and timely completion of specified projects.

**About the Organization:**

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Constellation West will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

ABOUT THEORGANIZATION

Constellation West is an award winning company that delivers Information Technology (IT) engineering services and solutions along with non-IT subject matter expertise world-wide. Established in 1997, Constellation West continues as an industry leader, partnering with key organizations. As a prime contractor or preferred subcontractor, we have a continual list of opportunities to fill across the nation with multiple agencies such as the Department of Veteran Affairs, Department of Defense, civilian agencies, and national intelligence community. Many of the positions supporting U.S. federal government require our employees be granted security clearances.

Constellation West provides fully integrated solutions spanning all aspects of system/network engineering, system/network administration, data management, information assurance, quality assurance, full lifecycle support, software development, and geospatial information services. Constellation West looks for the right people ready to step up and be part of a dynamic team.

Constellation West offers competitive salary and benefits including:

* Tuition reimbursement
* Competitive 401(k) plan
* Competitive Health Benefits
* 10 Paid Holidays!!
* 15 PTO Days!
* Veteran Hiring Preference

Constellation West is proud to be an EEO/AA employerM/F/D/V

Pay: $125,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Project Online: 5 years (Required)

title: Supervisor, Claims
description:
Supervisor, Claims
  
  

Who are we?
  
Versant Health is one of the nation’s leading administrators of managed vision care, serving millions of our clients’ members nationwide. We are driven by our mission to help members enjoy the wonders of sight through healthy eyes and vision.
  
  

As a Versant Health associate, you can enjoy a comprehensive Total Rewards package, which includes health and dental insurance, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) with company match, pet insurance, no-cost-to-you vision insurance for you and your qualified dependents. We are also invested in your success. There are many opportunities for advancement and development throughout all stages of your career with us.
  
  

See how you can make a difference with the support of strong leadership and a team environment.
  
  

See Everything, Be Anything™.
  
  

What are we looking for?
  
The Claims Supervisor is responsible for providing daily supervision of the Claims Department team. Employee management responsibilities include coaching and motivating staff, developing work-related skills and competencies, setting performance expectations, managing employee performance, training staff, recognizing, and rewarding contributions, scheduling work hours and tracking attendance, and providing hiring support.
  
  

Where you will have an impact
  
  

* Set performance expectations and manage team performance to ensure the Claims Department team meets and exceeds performance expectations
* Track and monitor team production and quality performance
* Support and facilitate daily, weekly, and monthly claims reporting
* Track and monitor workflows in collaboration with management and make changes to assignments to ensure department goals are met and exceeded
* Communicate with internal business partners to support claims processing activities
* Provide SME knowledge of claims processing and payment systems necessary to support and develop the team and department delivery
* Support claims team with claims related issues to include technical claims edit issue resolution and inter-departmental collaboration necessary to process claims to completion
* Assist with the processing of claims and claims related inventories when assigned
* Assist with testing changes to the system, where assigned
* Manage assigned workflows including but not limited to reject/denial letters and check related processes and tracking
* Work with management and internal business partners to identify, define, and implement process improvements and quality improvements
* Other duties as assigned


What’s necessary to do the job?
  
  

* Preferred Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or equivalent combination of experience and education
* Five years of experience in managed care industry with a working knowledge of claims processing, claim adjustments, refunds, self-funded accounts, eligibility, and customer services.
* Previous supervisory and/or management experience is required


HIPAA & Security Requirements
  
All Associates must comply with the Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) as it pertains to disclosures of protected health information (PHI) as described in the Notice of Privacy Practices and HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures. As a component of job roles and responsibilities, Associates may have access to covered information, cardholder data or other confidential customer information which must be protected at all times. As a result, Associates must explicitly adhere to all data security guidelines established within the Company’s Privacy & Security Training Program.
  
  

Versant Health will never request money from candidates who seek employment with us and will never ask for any payment as part of the recruitment process.
  
  

Versant Health is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer dedicated to attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Versant Health without regards to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  
  

The wage range for applicants for this position is [$55,000.00 to $60,000.00].
  
All incentives and benefits are subject to the applicable plan terms.

title: Microsoft Office 365 System Administrator - Part Time
description:
**Company Overview**


TestPros is a successful and growing business, established in 1988 to provide Information Technology (IT) technical support services to a wide range of Commercial and U.S. Federal, State, and Local Government customers. Our capabilities include Program Management, Program Oversight, Process Audit, Intelligence Analysis, Cyber Security, NIST SP 800-171 Assessment and Compliance, Computer Forensics, Software Assurance, Software Testing, Test Automation, Section 508 and WCAG Accessibility Assessment, Localization Testing, Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V), Quality Assurance (QA), Compliance, and Research and Development (R&D) services. TestPros is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


TestPros delivers innovative independent IT assessment solutions to critical challenges facing the nation and the world. We support the U.S. Federal Government and Commercial clients within the continental USA. TestPros is dedicated to making lives better, safer and more secure.

**Job Summary**


TestPros is seeking to fill a Microsoft Office 365 System Administrator to work for us on call during the business day. The role would be to administer Office 365 accounts, provide on-call technical support (reset passwords, help with email issues, network support, etc.), configure (and lock down) staff laptops, etc.

**Position:** Part time

**Citizenship:** U.S. Citizenship

**Location**: Remote

**Clearance:** None

**Responsibilities and Duties**


In this role, you will be responsible for the management, administration, and governance of the Office365 tenant, including Exchange Online, Teams Online, SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Security and Compliance Center, BOX, and more. You may also be required to set-up and lock-down company laptops.


Here is a typical IT Support request:


1. New Email Address and Cloud PC license for {Employee Name}.


2. Admin password for {Employee Name} laptop.


3. Configure/Setup BOX folder access.


4. Other administration duties.

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* B.A. or B.S. in computer science, information technology, human computer interaction, or related field preferred - however, we may also consider a college student intern.
* 3+ years Office 365 experience with 3+ years' experience with Microsoft Exchange
* Strong communication skills to effectively drive recommendations, priorities, and projects
* Proven experience driving business impact based on understanding of customer needs with a focus on change management and understanding customer impact
* Familiarity with Azure, AD, and Office365 authentications preferred
* Familiarity with DNS/DHCP and Domain Management preferred
* Proven design, configuration, integration, testing, maintenance, and support of Microsoft Office365, Exchange, Azure, Office suite, and Outlook applications

**EEO Statement**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Online Adjunct Christian Studies
description:
The College of Christian Studies is receiving applications for the position of adjunct instructor/professor for graduate-level courses offered online in the M.A. and M.Div. programs. Pay is based on level of education and course enrollment.

  

Online adjuncts must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Missouri, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, or Wisconsin.

  

North Greenville University is a teaching university of the South Carolina Baptist Convention. Candidates for adjunct positions in the College of Christian Studies are expected to be convictional Baptists who affirm the Baptist Faith and Message (2000), to maintain membership in a local church in friendly cooperation with the Southern Baptist Convention, and to teach in accordance with, and not contrary to, the university’s “Statement on Human Flourishing.”

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**:

* Teach graduate-level online courses as assigned by the program director.
* Develop syllabi, assessments, and course content materials as assigned by the program director.
* Effectively utilize and monitor the Blackboard platform and other learning management systems.
* Appropriately maintain student records, grades, and attendance to ensure accuracy and security.
* Meet all university deadlines for syllabi and grade submission.
* In a timely and professional manner, communicate with and respond to communications from students, administrators, and other university personnel.**Physical Requirements:**
* Speaking: Frequently convey detailed or important instructions and ideas accurately, professionally, and with a contextually appropriate tone and volume.
* Cognitive/Emotional: Ability to think critically and express emotions and thoughts in an honest, collegial, constructive, and prudent manner.
* **Working Relationships and Schedule**


Adjunct instructors/professors who teach online courses will report in matters uniquely related to teaching online to the program director for the affiliated online program.

  

This job posting in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee. S/he will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties as requested by his or her supervisor.


As part of the application, candidates must submit a resume, a CV, and official transcripts, as well as the contact information for two professional references and one reference from a leader in his or her church of membership.


Please direct any questions about working as an adjunct to Jeffrey.Rankin@ngu.edu.

  

* A terminal degree in the field.
* Relevant work experience is desirable.
* Prior teaching experience is appreciated.

title: System Administrator (Linux)
description:
**Company Overview:**

Andesa Services, Inc is a service and technology company. We are proud to serve the Life Insurance and Annuity industry through custom Software as a Service (SaaS) technology solutions and dedicated business support to end-users such as clients, brokers or policy holders. More information on these services can be found on our website at www.AndesaServices.com.



Andesa was established in 1983 and is located in Allentown, PA. We are a 100% employee-owned company via an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), which means when you join our team, you will not only become an employee-owner, you will be contributing to and taking part in the success and longevity of the company!


**Position Summary:**



Responsible for installation, configuration and support of the organization’s servers, systems and networks. Lead role in the support of both departmental and company projects and objectives, including researching, recommending, and implementing new technological solutions.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Installs, configures, and maintains Linux operating systems.
* Monitors systems performance and ensures compliance with security standards and updates via Red Hat Satellite.
* Proactively researches, plans, and implements changes to improve systems/network including virtualization.
* Administers, configures and maintains Storage Area Network infrastructure.
* Identify, document, and help implement monitoring points with Xymon.


**Secondary Responsibilities:**


* Uses Jira ticket application to monitor ticket queue and address all systems related service requests
* Participates in off-hours support


**Qualifications:**


**Essential Skills**


* Self-starter with ability to manage multiple projects.
* Must demonstrate advanced knowledge of Linux operating systems.
* Must demonstrate advanced knowledge of Linux command-line tools, and shell scripting.
* Must demonstrate advanced knowledge of Linux security concepts, security tools and practices.
* Must demonstrate advanced knowledge of fundamental networking/distributed computing environment principles.
* Must demonstrate advanced knowledge of VMware virtualization.
* Must demonstrate basic knowledge of network security concepts and solutions.
* Proven ability to maintain desktop and server hardware and software.


**General Skills:**


* Adjusts and is flexible to meet changing needs and demands of internal and external clients.
* Resourcefulness and ability to take the initiative in development and completion of work projects.
* Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills.


**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree or two-year technical degree or equivalent experience.
* At least 5 years experience with Windows AD and UNIX/Linux server and desktop operating systems.
* At least 3 years experience with network systems
* Fundamental knowledge of F5 applications, NGINX preferred.
* Fundamental knowledge of automation tools, Ansible preferred.
* Industry recognized certification preferred.

  



Equal Opportunity Employer:



In accordance with the law and in alignment with our values, Andesa seeks to hire talented individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences to help us achieve our Andesa Forever vision. We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and respectful to all potential and existing employee-owners. Therefore, we do not hire, fire, discipline, promote or make pay decisions based on characteristics that are protected by applicable laws and regulations. Protected classes may include, age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy and/or sexual orientation.

title: Linux Systems Administrator
description:
**WHAT WE WANT**

FriendFinder Networks is looking for a Linux Systems Administrator who will be responsible for availability, installation, configuration, provisioning, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software. You will respond to trouble tickets created by the NOC, monitor automations and internal customers; install new servers, rebuild existing servers, and configure hardware, peripherals, services, and settings in accordance with operational requirements. You have to document, update and maintain installation and configuration procedures on the Wiki, and will contribute and maintain best practices documentation for operations, security, and capital efficiency. Your contributions will ensure our systems will provide our customers the best possible user experience for everyone who visits our web sites 24 hours a day, every day of the year, all over the world.

**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* Ensure proper security, monitoring, alerting and reporting for the infrastructure
* Work with the NOC and DC Tech teams, using Tivoli monitoring and other tools to ensure the integrity and availability of our hardware, server resources, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
* Work with the incident team to diagnose and recover from hardware or software failures working with or as the Incident Commander to coordinate and communicate with our internal customers
* Assist project teams with technical issues in the planning phase of sites or project development efforts
* Gather system requirements and support several project teams in evolving, testing and rolling-out new products and services, then transitioning the site or product to post launch operations activities throughout life of the product or service
* Work with the R&D team and other systems engineers to make improvements
* Document processes and procedures and follow a formal change management procedure

**WHAT YOU MUST HAVE**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or equivalent work experience
* 5+ years’ experience administering Linux required or equivalent work experience
* Experience with Apache, nginx, lighttpd, and high volume web servers
* Experience with high volume mail servers
* Experience with monitoring tools, e.g. nagios, cacti
* Experience with kickstart or jumpstart maintenance and implementation
* Experience with load balancers
* Experience in analysis and system performance tuning
* Experience in Perl or Shell Scripting, with experience implementing automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools
* Experience with proxies / reverse proxies, e.g. ha-proxy, squid, varnish
* You must be comfortable with adult content
* You must be at least 21 years old

**WHAT IS PREFERABLE TO HAVE**

* Knowledge of protocols such as DNS, HTTP, SMTP, SNMP
* Knowledge of OSI model
* Knowledge of the challenges in a very large multifaceted global environment
* Comfortable with new technologies such as containers/Docker and container orchestration such as Kubernetes
* Ability to implement automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools, Puppet

**WHAT YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO DEMONSTRATE**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Critical thinking skills in a complex IT environment to analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve problems without direction
* Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
* High degree of honesty and integrity
* Team-player, positive attitude and flexible

**REPORTING TO THIS POSITION:** No direct reports

**PERKS**

FriendFinder Networks Inc. and its subsidiaries offer a business casual work environment, flexible work hours, and a competitive salary. The benefits package includes:

* 401(k) with a 6% match on eligible earnings with no vesting period
* Medical (Kaiser HMO, Blue Cross PPO), Dental, and Vision
* Flexible Spending Account for Healthcare and Dependent Care
* Life Insurance, AD&D, LTD and Short and Long Term Disability
* Paid Time Off (20 days PTO) and Holiday Pay (12 company paid holidays off)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Commuter Benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Health Club Reimbursement

**WE ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT WE DO**

Not only do we love what we do, but we truly believe in it. We grow through positive education, skill training, courses, big stories, and big dreams. We are constantly improving and striving for perfection to revolutionize and enhance the lives of our members.

**WE CARE ABOUT PEOPLE**

The main precondition of any relationship is the ability to put ourselves in someone else’s shoes to truly understand them. Satisfied customers, employees, and business partners are not just a cog in the wheel, but the main ingredient of the company’s success.

**WE EMBRACE DIVERSITY IN ALL FORMS**

FriendFinder Networks has embraced diversity from the beginning of its history dating back to the mid 1990s. We created the first online personals sites for gays and lesbians, for non-English-speaking audiences, and for those who enjoy what was once called "alternative lifestyles". Headquartered in San Francisco / Silicon Valley and staffed throughout the world, our team also relies on diversity of background, perspectives, and ideas.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $115,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* What is your experience with Kubernetes?

Experience:

* Linux: 5 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 2 years (Preferred)
* Ansible: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote
