title: Dedicated Administrator - AccuRoute
description:
At Upland Software, you’ll find smart, creative teams who love working together to deliver value for our customers, and a global culture of growth and possibility. Our operating model has always supported remote work—and as we keep growing and evolving our workplace, that won’t change. We’re passionate. We’re proactive. We take pride in our work, and we love a good challenge. Sound like you?

**Opportunity Summary:**
Working with one of the company's largest Enterprise customers, the Dedicated Administrator works as a Dedicated Administrator for our software solution in their environment. Mixing Technical and political skills with operations, the dedicated administrator is not only responsible for the architecture, troubleshooting and support of the technical environment, but also in the continued success of making sure the product is actively adopted by the client. Providing Technical support with the added insight of the customers unique environment and workflows, the Dedicated Administrator *offers the highest level of technical support and customer service by building relationships with key customer contacts and fully understanding their needs.* Dedicated Administrators are responsible for assisting administrators and users of Uplands products, answering questions, and helping them resolve issues quickly and effectively. Alongside this, the Dedicated Administrator will have developed, and will continues to build-on, an advanced level of knowledge and experience in a broad array of features of the AccuRoute system.

Reporting directly to the Director of Support, Dedicated Administrators are tasked with providing exceptional customer service while managing and resolving cases raised by AccuRoute/DWF dedicated customers. With an emphasis on strong technical skills, impeccable communication and Customer Service, team members will be responsible for providing speedy resolutions for our clients while working within the product Support team and wider business.
**Primary Responsibilities:*** Support clients with their use of the AccuRoute/DWF platform(s) – answering questions and resolving problems relating to functionality, features and configuration, etc.
* Provide expertise on the best use and practices of the software and environment
* Act as a trusted advisor to all facets of customer engagement
* Manage calls, both technically and politically between different customer business units (LOB, networking teams, server teams, security teams, etc.)
* Provide excellent customer service to AccuRoute/DWF clients. Understanding client queries quickly and providing concise, clear written and verbal instructions in order to reach a positive outcome on their issue
* Maintain relationships with key contacts at dedicated customers' sites
* Own and manage cases through their entire life-cycle, ensuring case administration is completed in line with departmental policy, escalating to Upland Support where appropriate.
* Pro-actively develop/maintain an in-depth understanding of AccuRoute/DWF platforms incl. core functionality, new features, and general updates
* Pro-actively develop/maintain an in-depth understanding of key product specific diagnostic tools/systems
* Maintain relationships with key departments

**Requirements:*** Knowledge/understanding of MS Windows Server on premise/Azure, Active Directory)
* MS SQL
* Understanding of Web Technologies (IIS, HTML, XML etc.)
* General knowledge of Security protocols (TLS, Encryption at Rest, Digital Certificates)
* Networking
* General knowledge of Disaster Recovery/High availability/Load Balancing
* Availability 24 hours for Urgent issues

**Desired Skills:**  

* Mail (Exchange, SMTP)
* Document Management Systems
* MFPs
* Telephony
 **Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. To learn more, visit** **www.uplandsoftware.com****.**

**Upland Software is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status.**

title: System Admin - IT Support Services
description:
**Description**


Simpson Strong-Tie is a leader in engineered structural connectors, software, and solutions for the building industry. We maintain a reputation as a trusted manufacturer, partner, and corporate citizen committed to our customers and employees.


Our founder, Barc Simpson established 9 Principles of Business we live out as company values and have made Simpson Strong-Tie an inspiring place to work since 1956. Our team of talented people are dedicated to our shared mission: to provide solutions that help people design and build safer, stronger structures.


Learn about our company culture directly from our team.

**YOU**


As a Systems Administrator, IT Support Services you will be responsible for the support of Simpson Strong-Tie’s IT and Endpoint Management Systems. Additionally, this role is responsible for owning, troubleshooting, and otherwise ensuring any critical or persistent IT issues/needs related to IT Systems in scope of responsibilities are addressed. This individual will take direction from IT leadership to ensure services are in alignment with company needs.

**WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING** (% of Time)


Administer key device management technology stack: Configuration, Management, Application Delivery, Security Patching and Hardening.(55%)


Address prioritized IT related issues and requests, follow up on outstanding incidents and requests and document support efforts in the service desk systems.(25%)


Suggest and implement Helpdesk/IT support process improvements.(10%)


Assure compliance with internal controls related to particular IT functions.(5%)


Write knowledgebase articles of solutions and “how to” information for users and IT technicians.(5%)

**DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE**


If you can do everything listed above, you’ve got what it takes. Perhaps some of the following would be helpful too:

* Relevant Networking Certification, preferred.
* IT Security Certification, preferred.
* 6+ years demonstrable Windows operating system, MS Office and Microsoft 365 expertise, required.
* 6+ years advanced administration of Microsoft Active Directory environments including understanding and knowledge of Active Directory components (OU, GPO’s, RBAC, etc.), required.
* 6+ years support of basic network infrastructure including LANs, WANs and WiFi., required.
* 6+ years Microsoft Server support, preferred.
* 6+ years Managing medium to large projects from planning to fulfillment, preferred.
* Self-Management – Display a high level of initiative, effort and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner.
* Teamwork: Build and sustain cooperative working relationships.
* Attention to Detail: Achieve thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing a task.
* Self-Management: Manage multiple projects and completing priorities.
* Problem Solving: Identify options for solving a problem and evaluate the strengths and weaknesses.
* Speaking: Effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
* Writing: Write in a clear, concise, and organized manner for the intended audience.
* Customer Focus: Quickly and effectively, solve customer problems including outstanding customer service and interpersonal skills.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**


The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, talk, and hear, and sometimes walk and stand. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may occasionally push or lift up to 25 lbs.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**


This job operates in a professional office environment where standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers/scanners, etc. are frequently used.

**TRAVEL REQUIRED**


This job requires 20% domestic travel.

**WORK STATUS & LOCATION**


This full-time, exempt position is located in Pleasanton, CA and is open to fully remote within the US.

**RELOCATION**


Relocation is not available for this position.

**Pay**


$80300 - $125300 / year

* Posted pay range is based upon national average and may vary depending on geographical work location

**#LI-REMOTE**

**REWARDS AT SIMPSON STRONG-TIE**


We recognize and reward employees with a carefully designed and comprehensive rewards package, including competitive compensation, quarterly bonuses or commission and first-rate benefits. May exclude some positions, such as seasonal jobs.

* **Quarterly Bonuses/Commission:** You will be eligible for either a bonus or commission, paid on a quarterly basis. We believe *all* employees affect customers, sales and revenue — directly or indirectly – and should be rewarded by sharing the company profits.
* **Benefits:** We provide a wide range of benefits for eligible full-time employees including: medical, dental, vision, retirement contributions, employee stock purchase and bonus plans, pay for holidays, vacation, sick days, funerals and jury duty, years of service awards, employee discounts, employee referral bonuses, charitable contribution matching, education reimbursement and more. View benefit plan details here: https://benefits.strongtie.com/.


In keeping with the Company's commitment to the communities in which it does business, we are an equal opportunity employer. This means that to the fullest extent required by local law, employment decisions are based on merit and business needs and not on race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender (which state law may define to include gender identity/expression, transgender identity, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, and gender stereotyping), sexual orientation, age, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, genetic information, medical condition, covered marital status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


Please note all job offers are contingent upon a successful background investigation and drug test. Simpson Strong-Tie's drug policy is based upon Federal Law, and therefore will screen applicants for amphetamines, including methamphetamines, cocaine, phencyclidine, opiates, and marijuana. Where applicable, drug testing for marijuana may be modified to conform with state and local laws.


#NowHiring #GetHired #Hiring #HiringNow

**Background**  


  

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‘leave no one behind’ approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and** **inspiring stories.**  


  

**UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.**  

  

**Office/Unit/Project Description**



The Office of Audit and Investigations (OAI) reports to the Administrator and is responsible for internal audit and investigations services to UNDP and its affiliated entities. OAI provides independent, objective assurance on the effectiveness of riskmanagement and the effectiveness and adequacy ofinternal controls. OAI also responds to allegations of misconduct by conducting andreporting on investigations. The Investigations Section of OAI is responsible for conducting investigations into allegations of misconduct, such as mismanagement, fraud, corruption, retaliation on whistle-blowers, workplace harassment, sexual harassment, abuse of authority, violation or willful disregard ofUNDP regulations, rules, and administrative instructions, that involve UNDP staff, contractors and other applicable persons.

  



OAI seeks to engage suitably skilled and experienced international personnel under the International Personnel Services Agreement (IPSA) to support OAI in providing Investigations Assessment Analyst in the designated to the OAI Investigations Section and its Information Analysis Team (IAT) in all aspects of the work that falls within OAI’s mandate and related work assignments.

  

  

**Duties and Responsibilities**  

  

The **Investigations Assessment Analyst reports to** the Investigations Advisor, Head of the Information Analysis Team (IAT), under the overall supervision of the Deputy Director (Investigations). The primary role of the **Investigations Assessment Analyst** is to work with the Investigations Assessment Specialist and:


* Review and assess complaints of misconduct allegations received by the organization against personnel and others (including fraud, corruption, sexual misconduct, harassment, abuse of authority, discrimination and other misconduct allegations);
  



Undertakes any related investigative, analytical or research activity as required to support the assessment of cases.


* Proposes action to close cases or to assign cases for investigation where appropriate.


* Drafts assessment reports of a high standard, providing an objective and factual summary ofthe assessment, with soundly based conclusions and recommendations supported by all evidence obtained in the course of the assessment.


* Collects, records and handles evidence appropriately, ensuring chain of custody and demonstrating knowledge of handling considerations for different types of evidence.


* Communicate with complainants, witnesses and other stakeholders on behalf of OAI.



When required, assists OAI Investigators with preparing interview plans, participated inwitness interviews, recording testimony and preparing witness statements and subject interviews.


* The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as deemed necessary for the efficient functioning of the Office and the Organization


  

**Institutional Arrangement**

The IPSA **Investigation Assessment Analyst** be tasked by the Head of Information Analysis Team (IAT). All work products produced by the **Investigation Assessment Analyst** asa result of this engagement are owned by UNDP and shall be submitted to OAI Investigations Section (IS).

**Required Skills and Experience**

* A first-level university degree (bachelor’s degree) in the above-mentioned fields of study, in combination with an additional two years of qualifying experience will be given due consideration in lieu of the advanced university degree.

**Disclaimer**  


  

Important information for US Permanent Residents ('Green Card' holders)  


  

Under US immigration law, acceptance of a staff position with UNDP, an international organization, may have significant implications for US Permanent Residents. UNDP advises applicants for all professional level posts that they must relinquish their US Permanent Resident status and accept a G-4 visa, or have submitted a valid application for US citizenship prior to commencement of employment.  


  

UNDP is not in a position to provide advice or assistance on applying for US citizenship and therefore applicants are advised to seek the advice of competent immigration lawyers regarding any applications.  


  

Applicant information about UNDP rosters  


  

Note: UNDP reserves the right to select one or more candidates from this vacancy announcement. We may also retain applications and consider candidates applying to this post for other similar positions with UNDP at the same grade level and with similar job description, experience and educational requirements.  


  

Non-discrimination  


  

UNDP has a zero-tolerance policy towards sexual exploitation and misconduct, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles.  

  

UNDP is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer that does not discriminate based on race, sex, gender identity, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, age, language, social origin or other status.  

  

Scam warning  


  

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

title: Digital Experience Administrator
description:
**About Education Design Lab**



Education Design Lab ("The Lab") is a national nonprofit that co-designs, prototypes, and tests education-to-workforce models through a human-centered design process focused on understanding learners' experiences, addressing equity gaps in higher education, and connecting learners to economic mobility. The process helps higher education leaders consider the needs of employers, using curriculum and program design as a gateway to make skills more visible to students and employers alike.



The Lab is unlike other organizations in the nonprofit education space. We are boundary spanners and work across disciplines and alongside schools, employers, entrepreneurs, government, foundations, nonprofits, and innovators. We are known for our work on the ground and have significant experience managing national and local learning cohorts, working with organizations such as Ascendium, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Citizens, Carnegie Corporation of NY, Charles Koch Foundation, Walmart, and a variety of state and regional community college systems. To learn more about the work we do and what we care about, visit www.eddesignlab.org.


**About the Digital Experience Administrator Role**



As a pivotal member of the Education Design Lab's Brand, Communications, and Thought Leadership team, the Digital Experience Administrator plays a central role in transforming our digital landscape. Reporting directly to the Director of Communications and working closely with organizational partners, this role is a collaborative and innovative project manager and WordPress wizard, instrumental in crafting exceptional user experiences on our website and various digital platforms. Collaborating with communications team colleagues, you will publish content, maintain an up-to-date website, and ensure an optimal user experience. From designing engaging web pages to troubleshooting bugs and coordinating with contractors for technical updates, your role will be multifaceted. This role offers a unique opportunity to merge creativity with technology, influencing how we tell our story and connect with our diverse audiences. Join us in shaping the digital narrative of Education Design Lab and contributing to our mission of innovation and impact.


**Responsibilities of the Digital Experience Administrator**  

In collaboration with three communications team colleagues, you will:


* Manage future website redesign project, serving as the primary liaison between the Lab and website design contractor.
* Collaborate across the Lab to ensure the organization's website is consistently updated with resources for our expanding network of practitioners and target audiences.
* Edit, design, and publish diverse content, including blog posts, project pages, landing pages, and other web-based materials.
* Catalog and thoughtfully display web-based resources to optimize the user experience.
* Monitor website analytics and leverage data insights to enhance user experience, accessibility, and reach.
* Promptly respond to, troubleshoot, and resolve bugs and website functionality issues.
* Coordinate with website and IT contractors for technical and security updates, ensuring seamless and secure operations.
* Develop a robust content knowledge base to effectively communicate Lab research and data to relevant audiences.
* Engage proactively with Lab partners, contractors, and stakeholders to create pertinent content aligned with organizational goals and strategies.
* Provide essential project coordination and content support as required.


**Qualifications and Experience**



Successful Candidates will have a majority of these skills or qualifications:


* Proven experience in designing and/or leading the launch of website redesign projects, showcasing a strong understanding of digital aesthetics and functionality.
* Comprehensive training and hands-on experience in User Experience (UX) Design and Search Engine Optimization (SEO), ensuring digital products align with both user needs and strategic objectives.
* In-depth knowledge and practical application of Google Analytics, demonstrating proficiency in extracting valuable insights to enhance user experience, accessibility, and overall digital reach.
* Extensive background in writing and producing multimedia content across various platforms, showcasing the ability to create compelling and engaging digital narratives.
* A strong understanding of web accessibility standards and best practices, ensuring an inclusive digital experience for diverse user groups.
* Familiarity with content management systems beyond WordPress, showcasing adaptability and versatility in managing various digital platforms.


**Durable Skills for Success**

  

**Collaboration:** Proven capacity to work productively with diverse individuals and groups toward a common goal; Demonstrates proficiency in the four core sub-competencies of effective collaboration:


* Strengthening relationships.
* Incorporating diverse perspectives.
* Utilizing active listening skills.
* Focusing on solutions rather than problems.


**Initiative:** Exhibits self-efficacy and proactively responds to identified needs; demonstrates self-awareness and utilizes both "failure" and "success" as opportunities for learning and development; has experience leading without an official title to motivate others and catalyze necessary action.


**Creative Problem-Solving:** Effective creative problem-solvers exercise four core sub-competencies: exercising divergent and convergent thinking; identifying patterns that may not be obvious; managing ambiguity; and applying an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas.


*Data shows that women and BIPOC candidates more frequently do not apply for a job because they don't feel that they meet all of the qualifications listed. Our job descriptions are general overviews, not a mandatory comprehensive list. If you feel passionate about our efforts and believe you have the skills to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you!*

  

*Additionally, given the Lab's mission and programming, applicants with lived experience as first-generation college students, community college students, those who attended minority-serving institutions (HBCUs, HSIs, AANAPISIs etc.), those who have experience as non-traditional students, and other underserved populations, are particularly encouraged to apply for this role. We do not require a college degree for our applicants for the role.*


**Compensation & Benefits**



The salary compensation for the Digital Experience Administrator position will fall within a range of $85,000 - $95,000 annually. The benefits package includes:


* 100% employer-paid medical and dental
* Short-term, long-term, and group life insurance coverage
* 403(b) - 100% matching immediately
* Professional development stipend of up to $1500 after the first year
* Semi-annual organization-wide retreats
* Rest and Relaxation:
+ The Lab participates in Responsible PTO for all full-time staff, which allows for managers to approve PTO with no limits and includes unlimited sick leave
+ 11 paid federal holidays
+ 2 weeks of paid organizational closures

**Location**



At this time, although we are a fully remote organization, we do require for our staff to live/work within the Continental U.S. We are unwilling to make an accommodation as we have numerous factors to consider, including foreign employment laws/taxes/benefits, and travel costs to meet with partners.


**Application Deadline: Friday, March 15, 2024**


**Application Instructions**



To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume by the specified deadline. Applicants will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the posted date. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us via email at careers@eddesignlab.org.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**



The Education Design Lab is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Tableau Administrator
description:
**Description**


**About us**

 **Why Norstella****?** Norstella unites market-leading companies that all have a shared goal of improving patient access. Each organization (Citeline, Evaluate, MMIT, Panalgo, The Dedham Group) delivers must-have answers for critical strategic and commercial decision-making.  

  

Together, we help our clients:  

* Assess the market need and competitive landscape
* Know precisely which drugs to prioritize in their portfolios
* Find out where the launch difficulties will be—before they are difficulties
* Track and improve market access post-launch

  

  

By combining the efforts of each organization under Norstella, we can offer an even wider breadth of expertise, cutting-edge data solutions and expert advisory services alongside advanced technologies such as real-world data, machine learning and predictive analytics. At Norstella, we don’t just deliver information and insights. We deliver answers you can act on.  

  

**The guiding principles for success at Norstella:**  

  

**01: Bold, Passionate, Mission-First**  

  

We have a lofty mission to Smooth Access to Life Saving Therapies and we will get there by being bold and passionate about the mission and our clients. Our clients and the mission in what we are trying to accomplish must be in the forefront of our minds in everything we do.  

  

**02: Integrity, Truth, Reality**  

  

We make promises that we can keep, and goals that push us to new heights. Our integrity offers us the opportunity to learn and improve by being honest about what works and what doesn’t. By being true to the data and producing realistic metrics, we are able to create plans and resources to achieve our goals.  

  

**03: Kindness, Empathy, Grace**  

  

We will empathize with everyone's situation, provide positive and constructive feedback with kindness, and accept opportunities for improvement with grace and gratitude. We use this principle across the organization to collaborate and build lines of open communication.  

  

**04: Resilience, Mettle, Perseverance**  

  

We will persevere – even in difficult and challenging situations. Our ability to recover from missteps and failures in a positive way will help us to be successful in our mission. **05: Humility, Gratitude, Learning**  

  

We will be true learners by showing humility and gratitude in our work. We recognize that the smartest person in the room is the one who is always listening, learning, and willing to shift their thinking.  

**Job Description**  

  

At Norstella, we pride ourselves on delivering innovative solutions to our clients, and our commercial sales team plays a pivotal role in achieving our business objectives. We are seeking a talented Tableau professional to join our Global Business Intelligence team and contribute to our continued success.  

  

This role is pivotal in managing and optimizing our Tableau environment. You will be responsible for the administration, configuration, maintenance, and support of our Tableau server, ensuring seamless functionality and performance across the organization. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for enhancing data accessibility and visualization. **Responsibilities**:

  

* Manage all aspects of Tableau server environment, including server management, application configuration, security controls, performance tuning and optimization, troubleshooting and support
* Strong knowledge of Tableau Server architecture and administration, including managing all sites, users, groups, and content on Tableau Server, investigating and resolving Tableau server issues and managing Tableau backup and disaster recovery planning.
* Strong understanding of data visualization concepts and best practices
* Advanced ability to integrate and troubleshoot database connectivity
* Conduct performance tuning and capacity planning to optimize Tableau server resources and enhance user experience.
* Manage Tableau server/site level content migrations and scheduling, backups, and restoration of Tableau repository.
* Perform regular monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization of Tableau Server to ensure high availability and performance.
* Implement security measures and access controls to safeguard data integrity and compliance with industry standards.
* Develop and maintain documentation, guidelines, and best practices for Tableau usage and administration.
* Provide user creation, permissions and provisioning, incident and technical support and training
* Stay up-to-date on Tableau product updates, new features, and industry best practices to recommend and implement improvements.

  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in an accredited field or equivalent experience
* Proven experience as a Tableau Administrator or similar role, managing Tableau Server and associated technologies.
* Strong understanding of Tableau architecture, deployment methodologies, and best practices.
* Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization tasks is a plus.
* Experience in data visualization concepts and design principles.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to detail.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Experience in the designing, building, customizing, and publishing Tableau interactive reports, visualizations, and dashboards
* Working proficiency with complex data from multiple data sources and building dashboards
* Demonstrated ability to understand new datasets and data structures
* Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
* Ability to creatively take on new challenges, be proactive and work outside their comfort zone
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with non-technical users
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is a plus
* Intermediate proficiency in SQL a plus
* Tableau certifications are a plus

  

  

*Join our dynamic team and contribute your expertise to drive the success of our commercial sales operations at Norstella. If you possess a passion for data visualization and storytelling, a strategic mindset, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we look forward to receiving your application.*  

  

**Travel**: 0-10%  

**Location**: Remote  

  

**Benefits:*** Medical and prescription drug benefits
* Health savings accounts or flexible spending accounts
* Dental plans and vision benefits
* Basic life and AD&D Benefits
* 401k retirement plan
* Short- and Long-Term Disability
* Paid parental leave
* Open vacation policy

  

  

*The expected base salary for this position is* ***$85,000-$95,000*** *annually. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.*  

  

*MMIT is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, gender reassignment, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Our ethos is to respect and value people’s differences, to help everyone achieve more at work as well as in their personal lives so that they feel proud of the part they play in our success. We believe that all decisions about people at work should be based on the individual’s abilities, skills, performance and behavior and our business requirements. MMIT operates a zero tolerance policy to any form of discrimination, abuse or harassment.*  

  

*Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description and feel passion and excitement, we’re just as excited about you.*

title: Database Administrator
description:
**Database Administrator**

  

Employee dedication contributes to our success, customer satisfaction, and our nation's most outstanding achievements. At Fusion Technology, we recognize that our employees are our greatest attribute. That is why our top priority is to attract, recruit, retain, and continuously motivate quality employees who meet or exceed customer requirements. Our dedicated people make Fusion Technology one of the fastest-growing information technology (IT) companies in West Virginia. As a HUBZone Small Business, we know what it means to work as one team. As such, we encompass all definitions of the word "team." So, are you ready to join ours?

 **Who is Fusion Technology?**

  

Fusion Technology is a performance-driven HUBZone Small Business concern residing in the heart of the beautiful mountainsides of West Virginia, steps away from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Criminal Justice Information Services Division's Headquarters. Founded in 2007 by an Engineer-by-trade, Fusion Technology dedicates our valuable resources to providing comprehensive IT services and solutions to mission-critical US Government programs and the Intel Community.

 **Day to day tasks include:**

* Document all platform service processes and procedures and maintain the artifacts in a document repository
* Perform system operation support including server system administration
* General troubleshooting of complex engineering issues for hardware, software, and network components
* Software installation, automations, and migrations
* Supporting backup and recovery tasks
* Evaluating new hardware and software, with the goal of improving and increasingly efficient operations

 **Required Qualifications:**

* 1-3 years of overall related experience with an IBM z/OS Mainframe environment
* Knowledgeable in z/OS and it’s subsystems
* Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience
* Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing
* Ability to obtain and maintain a **Secret** clearance.

 **Desired Qualifications:**

* z/OS Certifications and Training
* Knowledge of the following tools: Java, COBOL, CICS TS, Unix, OAM, IBM Apache Server, FDR, DFSMS, ISPF, CICS, Elastic, Ansible
* Ability to apply user requirements to the analysis, planning, and design of technology systems.
* Ability to communicate problems and solutions both verbally and in writing to the Government Lead.
* Ability to work independently and troubleshoot problems with speed and efficiency.
* Ability to work closely with others in a team environment
* Ability to interface with all customer levels.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  

The Database Engineering is operating 100% **Remote.** (with occasional travel to main work site for special events)

 **What matters to you matters to us:**


Fusion Technology values its employees and works hard to ensure proper care for them and their families. We desire to compensate employees in a competitive, motivational, fair, and equitable way with other employers in the marketplace. Salary is only one component of employee compensation but an integral part of recruiting and retaining qualified employees. However, at Fusion Technology, we take a comprehensive approach and consider each employee's needs to tailor a compensation plan that provides financial security and peace of mind. Our competitive package includes a best-in-class matching 401K program, comprehensive Cigna healthcare plan, a competitive employer contribution to a health savings account, vision and dental plans, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and personal leave, in addition to paid certifications and training.

  

Fusion Technology LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

  






EKJCLTML9R

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

In this role, you will be a key member of our growing Salesforce team (comprised of engineers and admins).This role is for a proactive individual that can help us continually improve and enhance our Salesforce platform, gathering requirements and feedback from various business units, designing scalable best practice solutions, and managing the product road map. Our Salesforce user experience is a top concern, and as such our Salesforce Administrators facilitate all aspects of user management including support tickets, training, and designing solutions with user satisfaction as a priority.  

This role requires a good understanding of the Salesforce platform, and a desire to continue to learn new things in Salesforce. Our Salesforce Administrators must understand both our current setup and our business objectives, to quickly identify areas of improvement. The Salesforce Administrator should be comfortable with change management and governance, communicating, prioritizing, and managing all aspects of a Salesforce project. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a team environment, with stakeholders at all levels and can translate technical information into layman’s terms, clearly explaining design options and their potential impact.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ User and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, sharing rules etc.
+ Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards and reports.
+ Sandbox environment management.
+ Identify and gather requirements, translating into best practice, scalable solutions with a focus on user experience.
+ Identify unused or underutilized platform features.
+ Collaborate on R365’s Salesforce platform roadmap by working with the Salesforce team and stakeholders to define priorities.
+ Own the communication of any platform changes to end users and stakeholders.
+ Data management to improve R365’s Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed.
+ Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer.
+ User support tickets through Salesforce Cases and Slack/Jira.
+ Monitor and improve user adoption.
+ New user and ongoing user training.
+ Technical documentation.
+ Working with integrated applications including Intacct, Clari, Salesloft, LeanData, ZoomInfo, Spiff, Marketo, Bizible, Gainsight, Pendo, Freshdesk etc.
+ Other duties as assigned.

### **What you'll need to be successful in this role:**

+ Valid Salesforce Certifications in the following: Administrator, Business Analyst.
+ 2+ years of Administrator experience on Salesforce & Force platforms.
+ Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to work with teams and stakeholders of different backgrounds and time zones in a multicultural environment.
+ Designing scalable, best practice solutions.
+ Excellent relationship-building skills.
+ Translating requirements into technical solutions.
+ Experience in change management and governance.
+ Training end users and key stakeholders.
+ Proven ability in producing technical documentation.
+ Available and responsive to questions.
+ Experience implementing Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards, and reports.
+ Experience working with Agile teams and use of tools such as Jira, monday.com, etc.
+ Experience working in a SaaS environment preferred.
+ Experience working with Apex Code and custom Apex Classes preferred.
+ Experience with managed packages and AppExchange preferred.
+ Experience with CPQ preferred.
+ Pacific Time Zone working hours preferred.

### **R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation**

+ This position has a salary range of $100K-$110K per year. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
+ 401k + matching
+ Equity Option Grant
+ Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
+ Wellness initiatives
  

#BI-Remote
$100,000 - $110,000 a year
R365 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all forward-thinkers who embrace change and possess a positive attitude to apply.

title: Systems Administrator
description:

title: Yardi System Administrator
description:
**About Us**

D2D Consulting is the go-to resource for project management and software implementation services. Providing customized development, quality assurance testing, data validation, comprehensive training and help desk support, D2D Consulting offers full end-to-end management and delivery of our client’s processes. D2D Consulting distinguishes themselves with a unique combination of deep business operations knowledge and technology expertise. As a result, we have become a trusted business partner who shares our clients’ vision, achieving a 100% client retention rate and 100% on-time and on-budget project implementation.

**Job Description**

The Yardi System Administrator is responsible for the administration and support of the software, including environment security, software upgrades, implementation of enhancements, management of open issues list, and configuration requests with the goal of ensuring business teams are able to use the system efficiently and accurately. The System Administrator will work closely with clients to understand their business requirements and configure Yardi to meet their needs.

**Responsibilities**

* Maintain and manage client’s Yardi systems to support Property Management, Accounting, and Asset Management functions. This includes acting as the Administrator/Super User for the software, enabling/disabling users, managing role-permissions, setting up new properties, scheduling reports, etc.
* Establish best practices and efficient workflows.
* Responsible for system administration, including maintenance of user security groups, new user set-up and security management, and general user security.
* Manage system upgrades, including testing of existing business processes to ensure efficient rollouts.
* Support data population as needed.
* Maintain property lists and account trees to support reporting, including removal of unused records as needed.
* Delete transactions as needed with appropriate approval.
* Monitor new entity/record setup for completeness and consistency.
* Work directly with business teams to capture customization requests, consulting with business users on Yardi functionality, capturing technical requirements as well as business use cases and building project plans for implementation, including prioritization.
* Oversee and complete system customization or configuration, including monitoring of third-party consultant work.
* Manage user support, including system training, troubleshooting, answering usage questions, and supporting the documentation of system processes.
* Support the extraction of data, including queries as needed to provide answers related to data.
* Responsible for Yardi vendor management, including submitting and tracking open cases with Yardi to ensure efficient resolution, tracking and advocating for software enhancements as needed, and attending vendor conferences.
* Design and implement processes and/or technology solutions to keep Yardi database in sync with other systems that depend on Yardi data.
* Communicate and/or meet with project manager, team members and others on a weekly, monthly, or quarterly basis to give updates and request support when needed. When problems need to be resolved, meet more frequently as needed to return systems to their properly functioning order.
* Stay current on Yardi product updates and new features.
* Contributes to D2D growth by sourcing work through net new and/or existing clients.
* Develop long-term relationships both internally and externally, through interacting and communicating effectively with teammates, clients, and executives.
* Travel based on client need, resource availability, and within CDC recommended safety guidelines.

**Qualifications and Education Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, finance or a related discipline or commensurate work experience required.
* 5+ years of experience implementing and administrative support of Yardi modules required.
* Familiarity with the full suite of Yardi products to include Voyager, Rent Café, Yieldstar, Nexus/Payscan, Forecasting; as well as with associated third-party integrations.
* Experience with Commercial, Elevate and IQ products.
* 2-3 years of experience working at an advanced level with core Microsoft office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) required, and experience with extended Microsoft Suite (Lists, Visio, SharePoint, Forms, PowerBI, Teams, etc.) strongly preferred.
* SQL query knowledge, experience with import/export tools and custom report design required.
* Experience in/exposure to real estate, tax, accounting, fundraising, investor relations and/or finance sectors valued.
* Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels internally and with external vendors.
* Ability to think independently and analytically and make recommendations accordingly
* Collaborative perspective across various audiences to include on-site, corporate departments, clients, and vendors
* Outstanding written and oral communication skills and must possess a strong commitment to customer service
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team

**Preferred Skills**

* Yardi certification
* Experience working with clients in the real estate sector
* Knowledge of other real estate management systems
* Understanding of implementation methodology

**D2D Consultant Expectations**

* Consultants are expected to be prepared for the workday and report or events/meetings on time. In instances when consultants cannot avoid being late or are unable to work as scheduled, they are to notify their supervisor as soon as possible. Consultants must also communicate to the client(s) of any delays. Frequent or unscheduled absences and repeated lateness may result in disciplinary action.
* Consultants are expected to resent a clean, neat, and tasteful appearance appropriate to their position whenever representing D2D.
* Consultants are required to submit work time into the tine management system by the end of every Friday in order to receive payment.
* Theft, unauthorized removal, negligence, destruction, or misuse of D2D property, property of D2D colleagues, or D2D clients is prohibited.
* Consultants who are members of outside professional organizations are to ensure that their involvement in those organizations does not negatively affect their ability to perform their job duties.
* Consultants will communicate regularly to direct management and report status of all projects on a minimum of a weekly basis.
* Consultants will not discriminate, harass, or unfairly treat colleagues or clients because of their race, skin color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation) religion, disability, age, or genetic information.

**Consultant Benefits** 

* Qualifying Sale Commission Opportunities
* Offices is closed on all major holidays

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Yardi: 5 years (Required)
* Database administration: 5 years (Required)
* SQL: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Yardi Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Network System Administrator
description:
**PURPOSE AND SCOPE:**
The Senior Network Systems Administrator is responsible for the design, planning, operation, security, and day to day management of the organization's org-wide network, servers, switches, network connected devices.
**PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:**
* Establish and configure networks for organization-wide use
* Determines the organization’s data management and information technology needs and decides how to set up the network and provide users and the organization as a whole with constant access to servers and data storage sites
* Determines areas of the IT infrastructure that need particular attention or expertise, directs system network administrators to resolve user-side issues, and manages the overall workflow of the IT department
* Maintains reliable system performance through active monitoring of error logs and user-reported server and/or network issues
* Conducts regular tests to ensure that the system meets expectations for speed, security, and reliability
* Work with technicians and administrators to conduct routine system audits, making recommendations to improve reliability and performance
* Lead teams to develop and deploy performance-enhancing measures throughout the network
* Works with team members to design and oversee server-side elements of an organization’s network infrastructure. This can include installing network-wide malware protection software, developing firewalls, and configuring databases and access on the back end
* Makes decisions regarding network/systems upgrades and repairs


**EDUCATION:**
* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent experience required.

**EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS**
* 5 – 7 years of experience installing, configuring, and managing infrastructure, hardware and software systems
* Highly experienced at configuring software and hardware including servers, networks, and operating systems
* Possess advanced skills in designing workflow and network diagrams along with technical manuals with a firm grasp of best practices and procedures to ensure that organization data is protected from intrusion or corruption
* Working knowledge of systems architecture, analysis, design, security methodologies, software installations, and trouble-shooting techniques
* Extensive experience configuring and managing software and hardware related to LANs and WANs
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
* Must be a team player, be organized and have the ability to handle multiple projects
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision or function in a team environment sharing responsibility, roles, and accountability
* Ability to lead without authority and motivate teams to achieve tactical and strategic goals. This is a highly responsible position that requires both quantitative and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated project management, organization and facilitation skills.
* High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and exude the appropriate level of judgment and maturity.


**Preferred Licensing/Certifications:**
* Certifications desired: CCNA, CCNP, Network+ Certification or A+


**CUSTOMER SERVICE:**
* Responsible for driving the HXG culture through values and customer service standards.
* Accountable for outstanding customer service to all external and internal contacts.
* Develops and maintains positive relationships through effective and timely communication.
* Takes initiative and action to respond, resolve and follow up regarding customer service issues with all customers in a timely manner

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
**Transflo is committed to building a culture where all employees can bring their best to work, where all employees feel valued, respected, and have a sense of belonging; Transflo embraces diversity and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.**
#### **The Opportunity**


At Transflo, our mission is to be the trusted industry leader delivering innovative customer-focused technology that connects and drives efficiency in the supply chain. Our passionate and engaged team delivers extraordinary customer value and experiences with technology solutions that make a difference for our customers.
**Responsibilities*** Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce environment especially for the Production.
* Primary point of contact for the Salesforce Customer Success team. Establish, monitor and drive action planning and execution for production org performance and health metrics
* Explore and test new platform specific features as part of Salesforce product release upgrades
* Manage installation of the AppExchange apps in Production and on full SandBoxes
* Manage storage, system clean up and data archiving
* Create and maintain the technical guidelines and documentation at the platform level including metadata dictionary
* Assist in analysis of Salesforce license usage and cost optimization
* Assist DevOps in establishing business continuity planning and help in implementing system backup and recovery processes
* Assist DevOps in release deployment process and sandbox management
* Assist in troubleshooting issues related to Salesforce platform in the areas of security, performance, access and user administration especially the ones with elevated access
* Coordinate with the Admins and Developers and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization.


**Qualifications:**
* 2-4 years of experience in the administration and maintenance of Salesforce.
* Experience in performing Salesforce upgrades and ensuring successful integration.
* Familiarity with the creation and configuration of Salesforce and/or Tableau dashboards and reporting.
* A track record of working successfully as a member of a team and taking initiative to own individual projects.
* Advanced excel skills and excellent written and verbal communication.


**Physical Demands:**
General office work- computer interactions for long periods of time, stress related to meeting deadlines.Salesforce Administrator

title: Server Administrator
description:
Connexus Credit Union - Who We Are:
Serving members across all 50 states, Connexus Credit Union is a member-focused cooperative that is proud to return profits to member-owners through high yields for checking accounts and deposit products, as well as competitive rates for personal, home, and auto loans. From its early beginnings on through the years, Connexus has remained a strong, growing, and secure financial institution that remains committed to serving the financial needs of our member-owners across the country.
Connexus offers an Amazing Benefits package:* 25 days of paid time off and 7 paid holidays
* 16 hours of paid Volunteer Time Off
* 401K Retirement with up to 6% employer match
* Excellent Health, Dental, Vision insurance, including multiple plan options
* Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions
* Employer paid Life insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement from $4,000 - $7,000 per calendar year
* Robust Learning and Development program that includes an annual professional development stipend

  

Connexus has a Values-Based Culture:
Our Values of Integrity, Respect, Transparency, Wellbeing and Synergy aren't just words on a page; our values dictate the actions of the organization and everyone within it. We demonstrate our values in every personal interaction, phone call, and email ‐ every day.
About the Role:
The Server Administrator is an individual contributor role and will report to the IT Operations Manager. We are looking for a Server Administrator to assist with installations, configuration, and maintenance on a variety of hardware and software items which often involve creating users accounts, carrying out backup and recovery functions and monitoring performance of servers.
The typical workweek may include working with business leaders and end users. Deploying servers in a physical and virtual environment, patching Windows, and Linux servers, and assisting with Security remediation efforts. To ensure success as a Server Administrator, you should exhibit sound knowledge of server infrastructure (Linux and Windows), M365 technology stack, Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, and other related technologies. Success will be measured in terms of your ability to deliver results that meet or exceed the agreed upon requirements.
Responsibilities:*Server and Ticket Administration: 60% of typical work volume** Under general supervision, assume the responsibility for maintaining the server environment (Windows and Linux).
* Participates in the patch management effort for the server environment (Windows and Linux) utilizing Ivanti ISEC and WSUS.
* Responsible for updating, managing and distribution of tickets utilizing the designated ITSM tool.
* Provisioning of CPU, memory, and storage resources.
* Lifecycle management of server environments.
* Participates in the integration of Active Directory and Azure AD with other systems.
* Participate in continuous improvement of all IT processes used by the Server team.
* Analyzing system logs and identifying potential issues with core systems.
* Escalation and coordination of issues with vendors as needed.
* Implement and maintain systems automation solutions.
* Oversee application deployments and upgrades.
* Interpret and solve problems either user initiated or via system alerts.
* Perform root-cause analysis of IT issues as needed in a complex, fast-paced environment.

*Platform Maintenance 20% of typical work volume** Responsible for monitoring the environment for changes to ensure systems are running efficiently.
* Support the organization by monitoring Monitor storage capacity of the environment to ensure appropriate space is available while addressing retention policies for the business.
* Installing with general supervision, operating systems, service packs, as well as security patches, bug fixes and protecting against security threats.

*Records & Document Management: 10% of typical work volume** Participates in updating server-related standard operating procedures.
* Create\\Update changes controls utilizing the designated Service Desk tool.
* Creates release documents (i.e., change control records) for significant change or new site releases.
* Ensures the confidentiality and security of records is maintained.

*IT Administration and Other Duties: 10% of typical work volume** Keeping informed of developments in server, security and cloud related technologies and products.
* Participating in investigation of emerging and evolving technologies and architecture.


Position Requirements:* This position is Remote.
* Associates degree in Networking, Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent work experience in IT Operations is Required.
* 2+ years of Server administration experience is Required.
* 1+ years’ experience with Azure Active Directory is Required.
* Proficient with Nutanix with AHV.
* Participate in planning, organizing, evaluating, and redesigning systems to meet company needs.
* Proficient in Linux and Windows environments.
* Experience in network, server, and application-status monitoring.
* Proficient in scripting/programming with emphasis in PowerShell.


Connexus Credit Union's Recent Recognitions:* 2022 Best Credit Union – Bankrate
* 2022 Best Checking Account – Forbes Advisor
* 2022 Best Credit Union in the U.S – Kiplinger
* Fourth Largest Credit Union in Wisconsin (by asset size)

*Equal Opportunity* *Employer/Disabled/Veterans/41* *CFR 60–1.4, 41 CFR 60-1.35*

title: Information Technology Administrator (Remote)
description:
**About Dew Wealth Management**

Dew Wealth Management is a Fiduciary Investment Advisory Firm that provides “Virtual Family Office” wealth management services to entrepreneurs through a model that is disrupting the investment advisory industry. Our visionary model and elite team of highly entrepreneurial advisors has resulted in an aggressive growth trajectory that Inc. Magazine has recognized as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies in the United States. We have also been lauded by Investment News as one of the “Best Places to Work for Financial Advisors,” and are a “Great Place to Work” certified company.

If you love being challenged by complex problems and are hungry for an opportunity to rapidly advance your skillset and career, Dew Wealth Management offers a collaborative and supportive culture that will invest in your professional development in equal measure to your investments in our clients’ success.

**About the Position**

If you’re looking for an opportunity to build out the nascent IT Department of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization, taking senior responsibility, not just for systems administration, but also for driving new initiatives designed to scale our IT infrastructure as this company grows from 34 employees to 100+ over the next few years, our IT Administrator (aka System Administrator) role may be for you.

Reporting directly to our , you will be the first full-time IT hire into this company, responsible for helping us reduce our independence on our outsourced IT vendor while also up-leveling (a) the technical support we can give our growing team of remote employees, and (b) the sophistication and scalability of our IT infrastructure. It’s an opportunity to play a pivotal role in building out the IT infrastructure of a rapidly growing company as it scales.

This is not an entry-level role. We’re looking for someone with significant experience in Office 365 network administration to come alongside us to up-level our IT architecture in a way that will help this company scale efficiently and securely. An ideal applicant would, therefore, have a degree in computer science, systems engineering, or network administration, as well as a Microsoft 365 Certification as a “Teams Administrator Associate” with an “Administrator Expert” certification being preferred. With that said, we understand that many of the most talented IT professionals took career paths that didn’t go through traditional educational institutions, nor have they prioritized chasing Microsoft certification to validate skills they have acquired through experience. So, if it’s possible for you to quickly get the aforementioned Microsoft Certifications, that would enhance your application. But we will give all applicants an opportunity to demonstrate their skills and experience throughout this process, even if they don’t check all the rigid academic and certification boxes that would be ideal.

**Working within a Distributed Workforce**

This is a fully remote role. Approximately four times per year, we will pay you to fly out to our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ to get an opportunity to connect with your colleagues in person and align on quarterly objectives. Beyond that, however, your primary interaction with your colleagues will be through the cloud-based tech stack we leverage to align our distributed workforce, which includes employees across the United States.

Notwithstanding the virtual nature of our model, at present, we are only hiring applicants who reside within the continental United States (excluding CA) to minimize HR and tax complexities and to keep our team within four time zones of each other.

**Key Responsibilities**

Provide administrative and technical support for all IT assets within our diverse tech stack.

* Serve as the primary administrator of all assets within our diverse tech stack.
* Creating user accounts, performing access control, and assist colleagues with issues as they arise.
* Performing diagnostic tests and debugging procedures to optimize computer systems.
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve any technical issues that arise, ensuring minimal downtime and disruption to operations.
* Configure and enforce SSO policies accross our tech stack, as well as all related password policies and security best practices.

Manage and up-level our hybrid server architecture.

* Configure and manage all aspects of Office 365 users, from email and group setup, to teams and SharePoint administraton.
* Plan, test, and implement upgrades to the network infrastructure to improve performance and security.
* Manage the installation of servers, network devices, and firewalls to ensure a secure and efficient network environment.
* Continuously monitor the performance of all servers, software, and hardware to ensure they are operating efficiently and effectively.
* Coordinate the deployment of new applications, ensuring they are integrated smoothly and efficiently into the existing infrastructure.

Drive the creation of enterprise-grade IT systems architecture and management.

* Drive the buildout and implementation of new IT initiatives. (E.G. Transition of our DMS to SharePoint Online.)
* Maintain and update technical documentation related to system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
* Work with Chief Operating Officer to put in place enterprise-grade security architecture and policies to comply with SEC expectations.

**Qualifications**

Required soft skills:

* Enthusiasm, high integrity, and a commitment to live out the organization’s 5 core values of transparency, collaboration, curiosity, visionariness, and hustle.
* Desire to grow intellectually and professionally as part of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization.
* Intellectually curious, with ability to help others navigate a tech stack designed to organize a distributed workforce.

Required Hard/Technical Skills & Abilities:

* Office 365 Administration
* SharePoint Online Administration
* Hybrid Network Administration, including familiarity with Active Directory administration and PowerShell scripting.

Education, Certification & Experience Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems engineering or network administration.
* Microsoft 365 Certification as a "Teams Administrator Associate" with an "Administrator Expert" certification being preferred.
* 3+ years of IT Administration experience within a professional services or tech firm at a minimum, 5+ years' experience preferred.

… or equivalent experience, and the ability to demonstrate the requisite level of technical skills the degrees and certifications above are designed to validate.

**Compensation**

Compensation for this role is $70,000 per year. Additionally, the firm offers a generous benefits package that includes, among other benefits, flexible PTO, fully subsidized healthcare, a 401(k)-matching program, and an Employee Stock Option Plan.

*Dew Wealth Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please submit all inquiries to recruiting@dewwealth.com -- there is no guarantee that you will be followed up with properly except by applying through the external site provided.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Employee stock ownership plan

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Desktop Administrator
description:
BNL Consulting is actively seeking a skilled Desktop Administrator with expertise in Microsoft Azure AD and Intune to join our IT team. This is a W-2, salaried position. This opportunity will be remote. As a HUBZone small business, BNL Consulting will show a preference for candidates that are located in a HUBZone. To check your status please use this link and enter your address: https://maps.certify.sba.gov/hubzone/map#center=44.722800,-103.249700&zoom=4

The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining desktop environments and user accounts, ensuring the smooth operation of hardware and software systems across the organization. Experience with Azure AD will be used to manage user accounts and will be the primary login location for Single Sign On (SSO) applications. Another key aspect of this role involves leveraging Microsoft Intune for device management, application deployment, and security enforcement. Along with desktop device management this role will also be responsible for managing user accounts and account access to BNL supported software and web applications.

**Responsibilities:**

* Employee account management using Azure AD and Azure application endpoints for SSO
* Utilize mobile device management systems (SCCM, Intune, Apple Business Essentials, etc.) to keep Windows PCs and Apple Macs updated and patched to ensure compatibility, usability, and security
* Manage and maintain desktop infrastructure, including hardware, operating systems, and applications.
* Utilize Windows Autopilot to bootstrap new employee hardware
* Integrate desktop systems with other enterprise technologies, such as Active Directory, Office 365, Google Workspace, Jira and other BNL supported software and web applications.
* Maintain clear and effective communication with team members and clients, both verbally and in writing.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of six years of experience in the IT services field.
* Minimum of two years of experience as a intune administrator
* Windows Active Directory experience managing users and group policies
* Familiarity with Powershell, Python, Bash or other scripting languages
* Bachelor's degree in an IT-related field.
* Demonstrated experience in troubleshooting operating system issues.
* Strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
* Proven track record of strong problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and effectively self-manage tasks.
* Must be a U.S. citizen or eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship for W-2 employment.

**Preferred Qualifications (Nice-to-Haves):**

* Apple Business Manager and Google Workspaces
* Proficiency utilizing and managing the Jira platform

**Additional Information:**

* Interviewees will be required to participate in video calls.
* References will be required for consideration.
* We are looking for a candidate in a HUBZone. Please use this link to confirm your eligibility: https://maps.certify.sba.gov/hubzone/map#center=44.722800,-103.249700&zoom=4

title: Database Administrator
description:
Description:

Are you excited about a career in SaaS that has a direct effect on the hospitality industry? This might be the perfect opportunity for you!

**In this role you will:**


A Database Administrator at Actabl focuses on the needs of the Data & Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing changes to the source systems at the direction of the Data Engineering team’s needs as well as Development and IT.

**Typical Functions:**

* Monitor and maintain: Performance of database systems resources and query throughput, Database storage resources, and Database maintenance plans for backups, index rebuild/defragmentation, and database statistics
* Manage and maintain: Transactional replication system, SQL Server Availability groups, and Database documentation as required
* Implementing changes to the source systems to assist Change Tracking for Data Engineering team’s ETL processes, including new/modified fields, inserts, updates, and deletes.
* Maintain and administer database security access
* Troubleshoot and resolve database connectivity issues
* Optimize SQL code as necessary
* Follow Problem Management processes to troubleshoot and resolve recurring issues
* Proactively monitor and respond to MS-SQL database alerts
* On-call requirements in rotation to ensure 24 x 7 support of database operations


Requirements:
**At least 3 years experience in:**

* Database administrator in Microsoft SQL Server environment
* Microsoft SQL Server Availability Groups
* Transactional Replication
* Transact SQL
* Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO)
* Monitoring & Diagnostic tools
* Working with Windows server, including Active Directory and disk configurations

**Experience that is a plus:**

* Microsoft Azure
* MySQL
* Snowflake
* Data Warehousing
* ETL/ELT
* Windows Failover Clustering
* PowerShell
* Cloud migrations

**Personal Characteristics**

* Self-starter, open to and proactive in learning new skills
* Excellent communicator – written and oral
* Stellar time management and organizational skills
* Resourceful – figures out how to achieve results creatively with finite resources
* Strong attention to detail
* Thrives in a nimble, lean, fast-paced startup environment
* Works collaboratively and energetically
* Impeccable integrity and ethical standards
* Self-aware, accepting, honest, open, and respectful of others

* Leadership development

You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: System Administrator (IT)
description:
**System Administrator**
**POSITION SUMMARY**
The System Administrator is responsible for managing Allied Benefit Systems’ private cloud server environment including maintaining systems availability, configuration changes, performance tuning, security vulnerability remediations, and ensuring data protection.
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT change control policies and procedures.


* Performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and other software packages.


* Monitors and tunes the server environment to achieve optimum performance levels.


* Installs and monitors security auditing software and remediates defects based on security policies.


* Develops and promotes standard operating procedures.


* Provides technical oversight for new technology projects.


* Develops and maintains a comprehensive operating system, hardware, and software configuration database/library and all supporting documentation.


* Responds to system alerts and engages in troubleshooting and problem resolution.


* Collaborates with IT leadership and vendors on capabilities and improvements needed to meet customer requirements.


**EDUCATION**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent work experience.


**EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS**
* 5 or more years’ experience as a Windows / VMware systems administrator in public / private cloud environments required.


* 5 or more years’ experience as a Systems Administrator in an environment supporting an organization of 500 – 1000 employees, or similar in size, scope, and complexity is required.


* Expert level experience with Windows Server operating systems required.


* Expert level experience with Microsoft Active Directory required.


* Experience with PowerShell CLI Scripting and Automation required.


* Expert level experience with software distribution and automated patch deployment tools (Tanium, BigFix, SCCM) required.


* Expert Level experience with VMware suite of products required.


* Microsoft SQL Server experience required.


* Knowledge of networking and security technologies preferred.


* Experience with data protection technologies (example Cohesity, Zerto, etc.) preferred.


**POSITION COMPETENCIES**
* Job Knowledge


* Time Management


* Accountability


* Communication


* Initiative


* Customer Focus


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**
* This is an office environment requiring extended sitting and computer work


**WORK ENVIRONMENT**
* Remote
