title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
At Cast & Crew, we've empowered creativity and supported the global entertainment industry for decades. Together with our family of brands - Backstage, CAPS, Checks & Balances, Final Draft, Media Services, Sargent-Disc, and The TEAM Companies – we operate as a combined entertainment technology and services provider offering industry standard screenwriting accounting software, digital payroll products, data & reporting, and a host of creative tools. The industry continues to move faster than ever, and the need for our expertise, our technology, and our people has never been greater. We are a production's best ally every step of the way. **#OneCastOneCrew**

**About Cast & Crew**  

We grew from a modest small business in 1976 to be the premiere provider of entertainment technology and solutions, staying true to our mission of modernizing content production and leading the digital transformation within the industry. Our cloud-based solutions and industry expertise help streamline the entire production lifecycle and have revolutionized how content is made. We now have a global workforce across a host of storied brands, spanning all areas of produced and live entertainment, from film, television, streaming, to advertising, live events, and short-form.



**About the Role**



The Salesforce Administrator will play a vital role within our Salesforce Support Team. We are seeking a proactive individual that can help continually improve and enhance our Salesforce platform, gather requirements, design scalable best practice solutions, and effectively meet the demanding needs of the Salesforce project. The ideal candidate will be able to work effectively on Lightning Platform with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Experience Cloud, and be highly proficient in configuring within the lightning platform using flow builder and other Salesforce configuration tools.



The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the Salesforce platform, best practices, and can effectively support our current setup and our business objectives.


**Key Duties & Responsibilities:**



This is a varied technical and business facing role, with the following responsibilities:


* All aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules
* Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, milestones, assignment rules, approval processes, custom objects, lightning record pages, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, custom metadata, mobile administration, reports and dashboards
* Understanding of basic triggers/Apex code knowledge
* Sandbox environment management
* DevOps/release management experience
* Identify and gather requirements, translating into best practice, scalable solutions with a focus on exceptional user experience
* Identify unused or underutilized platform solutions
* Create roadmaps and set priorities, working closely with Salesforce manager and stakeholders
* Own the communication of platform changes to end users and stakeholders
* Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed
* Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer
* Daily user support Issues for a community of over 400 users
* Monitor and improve user adoption
* Ongoing user training
* Technical and business documentation
* Management of integrated applications including but not limited to Okta, OwnBackup, Five9, zAgile, Cloudingo and Conga


**Skills and Experience Required:**


* Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent
* Salesforce Certifications (Administrator or Advanced Administrator)
* Expertise in Salesforce best practices across the platform, including third party applications
* 5+ years of experience in Salesforce Administration
* 5+ years of experience in computer software admin/development in a company environment
* Experience in implementation and configuration of Sales, Service, Marketing and Experience Cloud
* Excellent ability to work in cross-functional teams
* Must be able to support users in a "helpdesk-like" environment as well as in a project based one
* Regularly evaluate new Salesforce features and third-party solutions and explain benefits and risks
* Strong communication, presentation, and writing skills
* Strong project and process background
* Plans and carries out responsibilities with minimal direction
* Must be able to work in a fast pace with high level of accuracy
* Must be a fast learner
* Background in client account management, with a focus on the Entertainment sector (Major Studios preferred - big plus)


**Special Work Conditions**


* Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.

  

Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs. Compensation range for candidates in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location.**The compensation range for this position is:**


$100,000—$115,000 USD**Benefits**



Cast & Crew provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, health and wellness programs, employee discounts, and more! Note: Cast & Crew benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.



Due to the high volume of applicants, it is likely that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  

  

CA residents: Your personal information may be collected in connection with certain services provided by Cast & Crew or its affiliated companies. A summary of your California privacy rights can be found at: https://www.castandcrew.com/privacy-policy/



Cast & Crew is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

title: Cybersecurity Administrator
description:
Velocity is seeking to hire a Cybersecurity Administrator. The **Cybersecurity Administrator** will assist the Director of Cybersecurity in the day-to-day operations involving information security. The ideal candidate will have knowledge and understand the differences between vulnerabilities, threats, and risks and should know how to prioritize incidents or events that could lead to disclosure, destruction, modification, or disruption of data assets. The candidate should be passionate about cybersecurity, have the willingness to learn, and have the drive to complete tasks beyond normal business hours if needed. Ability to learn new technologies and security related threats.  

  

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**:
* Perform regular tasks related to the administration of user accounts and groups
* Monitor event logs for anomalies and take action when needed
* Manage and improve permissions and account provisioning processes
* Gives input to Engineers and Management on the design and implementation of systems
* Understand and recommend changes to the security landscape, tools and processes for continuous improvement
* Participate in and help manage the security incident management program
* Lead forensic investigations relating to security incidents and or breach
* Investigate security alerts/incidents
* Remediate issues that arise due to virus, worms, rootkits, malware, etc.
* Perform on-going vulnerability scans
* Perform on-going phishing exercises
* Help lead Security processes around HITRUST, PCI and other compliance regulations
* Encrypt data that is sensitive for “data in motion” and “data at rest"
* Demonstrate a strong ability to work in various operating systems that support business systems
* Offer technical advice to both internal and outsourced partner resources to help solve technical and business problems
* Assist in the development of guidelines and/or policies, working within the scope of the system and usability
* Play a role in company projects as a representative of cybersecurity
* Assist in providing end-user support and system maintenance
* Work with the other IT team members on establishing and maintaining processes for data security & privacy
* Help maintain and update our company BC/DR & Security Incident Response plans
* Help execute mock exercises and scenario driven learning
* Manage and administer our cybersecurity training program and associated LMS statistics


  

**Preferred Qualifications**:
* Education – AAS in Computer Science, Cyber Related Degree or equivalent experience
* 1+ years of information security and/or system administration experience
* 3+ years of IT experience


  

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required**:
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate and summarize so that information can be consumed at a management level
* Strong partnering skills; able to work effectively with other groups and teams
* Strong analytical skills; able to assess and solve issues in a high-pressure environment
* Strong written and verbal skills and presentation skills
* Strong organizational skills; must be able to multitask without sacrificing attention to details
* Experience with project planning as well as deployment strategies
* HW/SW installation, configuration, and troubleshooting
* Knowledge of scripting languages
* Knowledge of Network Security
* Knowledge of Active Directory
* Knowledge of Disaster Recovery
* Strong knowledge and understanding of PCI and SOX compliance requirements

**Why you’ll love working at Velocity**
We are an energetic bunch — eager to succeed and have lots of company pride. We promote a collaborative work environment that prioritizes strengthening relationships with our customers and team members to achieve our goals.
As a growing technology solutions and services company, every team member at Velocity has the opportunity to make an impact as we challenge ourselves to provide the best technology and customer experiences in the business. We’re excited about what we do, why we do it, and who we do it for.
**Diversity and Inclusion**
Velocity is committed to diversity and inclusion and is dedicated to fostering a work environment where all team members are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have equal opportunities to thrive. Our team members work collaboratively and draw inspiration from various perspectives and experiences that make each of us unique. This strengthens our connections with our team members, customers, and communities.
**Our Values – Collaborative and Strong at the Core**
* Customer-obsessed
* One team
* Do the right thing
* Let’s go!


**Our Benefits**
* Medical, Dental, Vision
* PTO & Paid Holidays
* 401K – with Employer Match
* Paid Parental Leave
* Company provided Life Insurance, Short/Long-Term Disability
* Supplemental Benefits Available


**About Velocity MSC**
Velocity started in 2005. Velocity's customer-obsessed approach, combined with its customized voice and data network solutions, and support services, enhances how multi-location enterprises communicate and do business. That’s why Velocity serves thousands of Fortune 500 companies across various industries. With over 500 employees, 13 redundant data centers, 450 carrier agreements, and 5,500 certified technicians throughout the U.S.— Velocity is an unstoppable force. To learn more, please visit https://velocitymsc.com/careers/.
Velocity is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Velocity is an active participant with E-Verify.

title: Director of Innovation and Technology (remote)
description:
.


We’re looking for a Director of Innovation and Technology to lead, develop, and implement the organization's overall technology strategy. This person will ensure that HSRI’s technology initiatives align with our principles, goals, and mission. They will identify emerging technologies and trends and make recommendations when appropriate to the executive and leadership teams. This role involves managing a multidisciplinary team, driving innovation, optimizing technology resources, understanding technology needs, and playing a pivotal role in data governance to support projects and programs.

 **Who We Are**


HSRI is a nonprofit organization that conducts research and evaluation to improve health and human service systems. We work at the local, state, and federal levels. We help develop measures, data collection instruments and protocols, advanced analytics, and data visualization strategies. Our goal is to help public agencies understand and demonstrate the real-world impact of the services they provide, helping them transform their policies and practices to improve their outcomes.

  

Our teams have an unwavering commitment to envisioning equitable policies and solutions that create a stronger society for us all. HSRI is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse team, bringing as many possible perspectives as possible to bear on services that can profoundly affect people’s health and well-being by addressing social determinants of health. We are committed to building an inclusive environment where people of all backgrounds can come to do their best work.

 **Responsibilities**

* Evaluate and implement innovative solutions for the organization and in collaboration with project staff that enhance research capabilities and productivity
* Manage research and development activities to stay ahead of industry trends, explore new technologies, and maintain a competitive edge
* Prepare regular reports and presentations on the department's performance, projects, and technology trends
* Monitor the performance of technology systems and identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency improvements
* Oversee the development of new products and/or enhancements to existing products, ensuring they align with the organization’s technology vision
* Set standards by ensuring that technology solutions are scalable, secure, and meet performance requirements
* Collaborate with other team leads, researchers, project directors, and management to understand their technology needs and provide solutions
* Manage product and team performance by setting goals, establishing priorities, and conducting regular performance evaluations
* Manage departmental budgets and resources efficiently, ensuring cost-effectiveness
* Identify organizational technology needs and support the process of hiring or identifying appropriate vendors. Evaluate and negotiate contracts with technology vendors and service providers.
* Work in collaboration with others to develop and implement a comprehensive data governance framework to ensure data quality, privacy, and security across the organization
* Establish and maintain data management policies and procedures, including data classification, access controls, and data lifecycle management

 **Other Duties and Responsibilities**

* Provide oversight for technology-related projects, ensuring they are executed effectively, on time, and within budget
* Collaborate with project managers, data stewards, and researchers to identify and mitigate risks
* Act as a liaison between the technology department and other staff
* Establish and maintain data management policies and procedures, including data classification, access controls, and data lifecycle management
* Additional duties, as assigned

 **Supervisory Responsibility**

* Lead, mentor, and motivate a diverse team of technology professionals, including engineers, developers, database administrators, and support staff
* Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages knowledge-sharing and cross-functional cooperation
* Work closely with teams to understand their technology needs. Communicate effectively with executives and other clients and funders.

 **Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; advanced degree preferred. 8-10 years of experience in technology leadership roles, preferably in a non-profit, research, or innovation-focused environment
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS
* Familiarity with database management systems
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
* Ability to manage and lead multidisciplinary teams
* Ability to align technology initiatives with overall business objectives
* Ability to define and support data stewardship
* Financial acumen for budget management
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative work environment
* Ensure ongoing training and development for technology staff. Keep the team's skills up to date with industry advancements.

 **Hours**


Full-time – 40 hours


This position allows flexibility in core hours.

 **Location**


This is a remote position with an option to work from our Cambridge, MA, office, which is accessible by public transportation. HSRI does not permit remote work arrangements based in California, the U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and outside the United States.

  

Must have unrestricted authorization to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.

 **Additional Information**


HSRI offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes:

* Health
* Dental
* Short- and Long-Term Disability
* Life Insurance
* 403(b) Retirement Plan
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Education Assistance Program
* 10 Paid Holidays
* Remote Work Stipends (e.g., home office improvements, mobile/internet services)

 **Salary Range**


$154,288 - $196,037


Pay is commensurate with skills and experience.

  

HSRI is committed to pay equity in providing employees with equal pay for equal work and carefully considers a wide range of compensation factors, including, but not limited to, prior experience, education, certification(s), license(s), skills, expertise, location, internal equity, and other factors that are job-related and consistent with the organization’s needs. Depending on eligibility, your offer may include 403(b) participation, paid time off, and medical, dental, group disability, and life insurance coverage. Our offer of employment takes into consideration total compensation, including benefits.

  

For more information on HSRI, please visit www.hsri.org.

 **How to Apply**


Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a cover letter and resume/CV through HSRI’s Career Center.


You can copy/paste the URL into your browser: https://workforcenow.adp.com/jobs/apply/posting.html?client=hsri&ccId=19000101\\_000001&type=MP&lang=en\\_US ;

  

You can also mail materials to:


Attention: Human Resources


Human Services Research Institute


2336 Massachusetts Ave.


Cambridge, MA 02140

  

No phone calls or email inquiries, please.

 **Disclaimer**


This profile is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to do this job. The above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required and should not be construed as declaring what the specific duties and responsibilities of any position shall be. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with/or without notice.

  

External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the American Disabilities Act (ADA), must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by leadership on a case-by-case basis.

title: System Administrator
description:
**Introduction to Briefly**


Briefly, is a support organization, professionally running the back-office operations of a tech-enabled, highly selective, global law firm consistently recognized for its excellence, innovation, and teamwork throughout its 45 offices in 14 countries and five continents. This disruptive business model has widely become known amongst the most innovative in the legal industry prioritizing collaboration, dynamic innovation, consistent excellence, agility, and efficiency. These core principles provide our firm with an insightful understanding of how we can continue to push our growth year over year.


**Position Summary:**

We are currently seeking a full-time, highly skilled System Administrator to join our dynamic legal firm's IT team. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in Azure Active Directory group management, telecom, data migration, Citrix, software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development. As a System Administrator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and efficiency of our IT infrastructure to meet the unique needs of our legal practice. This position is a fully remote opportunity.

**Essential Functions & Responsibilities**

* A problem solver, that can act as technical project lead, manage workload and complete tasks on time.
* Experience in the support of mid-large-scale environments, multi-users, multi-site.
* Experience in the support of a remote work force, networks and PCs.
* Well-versed with the implementation and managing of Microsoft solutions in the Cloud & OnPrem.
* Windows Deployment Technologies - Imaging, Sysprep, Provisioning Packages, DISM
* Entra ID
* Azure
* Windows 10/11, Server
* SQL
* SharePoint
* Intune Device Management - Conditional Access, Compliance, Security Baseline, and App Policies
* Group Policy
* Conditional access
* Microsoft 365
* Scripting - PowerShell, VBScript
* Software and hardware provisioning
* Access Management - Matrix, RBAC, Automation, Lifecycle management.
* Can provide complete lifecycle support of existing and new environments including maintenance, software updates, troubleshooting, vulnerability management and remediation.
* Phone VOIP - Knowledge of MS Voice and Ring Central
* Experience with RBRO, iManage Work, iManage SPM,
* Experience with data management solutions and data migration processes.
* Assist in research and procurement of firm wide software and hardware solutions.
* Familiar with using PowerShell for automation
* Administer IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS based enterprise applications.
* Document processes and troubleshooting steps for knowledge base articles utilized by other IT Support members.
* Communicate with users to understand, identify, document, and resolve problems.
* Provide telephone, in-person, and online support to end-users.
* Coordinate activities with the IT leaders.

**Essential Capabilities**

**Azure Active Directory Groups:**

* Design, implement, manage, and maintain Azure Active Directory groups and policies to streamline and ensure proper access controls and permissions.
* Ensure proper integration of endpoint devices with Azure AD for seamless authentication and access control.
* Troubleshoot Azure AD-related issues and implement necessary improvements.
* Manage Azure Active Directory groups, ensuring accurate user access and permissions.
* Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate Azure Active Directory with other systems and applications.
* Monitor and respond to security incidents related to Azure Active Directory.
* Design and manage Azure Active Directory groups to streamline access control and permissions.
* Collaborate with IT administrators to ensure AAD groups align with organizational policies and legal compliance requirements.

 **Endpoint Troubleshooting and Support:**

* Provide advanced technical support for endpoint-related issues, collaborating with the IT support team to resolve incidents promptly.
* Develop and maintain documentation for troubleshooting procedures and best practices.

 **Endpoint Management:**

* Familiarity with the development, implementation, and management of endpoint strategies and solutions for endpoint configuration, deployment, and troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with software packaging and deployment.
* Knowledge in supporting legal-specific software and applications.

**Collaboration and Communication:**

* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, and security teams, to align endpoint strategies with organizational goals.
* Communicate effectively with end-users, providing training and documentation as needed.

 **Documentation and Training:**

* Create comprehensive documentation for system processes and management, network diagrams and configurations.
* Provide knowledge transfer for IT staff and end-users as required.

 **Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation.
* Proven experience in software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development.
* In-depth knowledge of software packaging tools, endpoint imaging processes, and security best practices.
* Hands-on experience with Azure Active Directory, group management, and integration.
* Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Experience in supporting law firms preferred.

**Job Related Competencies**

* Technical capabilities as described above
* Solution oriented
* Attention to detail
* Customer focused
* Ability to work independently
* Commitment to operational improvements and efficiency
* Integrity
* Leadership
* Strategic Thinking

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Briefly, Inc. is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable law. Our firm values diversity and inclusion, fostering an environment where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic is strictly prohibited. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply for opportunities within our firm.

**Accommodation for Applicants with Disabilities**


Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Briefly. If you have a disability or special need and need assistance participating in the application process, please let us know.

**E-Verify**


This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your form I-9 information to confirm you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: System Administrator
description:
At Advantive, we make purpose-built software for specialty manufacturing and distribution businesses that streamline complex processes, optimize operations visibility and throughput, and drive improved quality, profitability, and revenue growth. Deeply embedded in our customers’ businesses, Advantive’s software solutions add value along the full manufacturing and distribution lifecycle.



Our customers, who include corrugated and packaging manufacturers, equipment and supply wholesale distributors, and automotive and other specialty manufacturers, benefit from our solutions that have been honed over decades in the marketplace. We know our customers’ businesses intimately and deliver software to address their needs.


**Summary -**

As a System Administrator at Advantive, you'll leverage your technical expertise to administer and optimize IT systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance. Your responsibilities will include deploying and configuring system components, monitoring system health, and promptly addressing any issues or anomalies. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide effective solutions, while also documenting processes and procedures for internal reference. Additionally, you'll play a key role in implementing automation solutions, and integrating tools to enhance system efficiency and streamline workflows. Your commitment to operational excellence and adherence to IT best practices will contribute to maintaining a culture of discipline and efficiency within the organization.

  


**Job Description**


**Responsibilities:**


* Administer, maintain, configure, and ensure the reliable operation of a Microsoft 365 tenant serving 500+ end users
* Manage Microsoft Exchange, including configuring mail flow, mailbox management, security settings, and overall support within the Microsoft 365 Exchange Online environment
* Administration of Microsoft SharePoint Online including configuration of security permissions, Site and document library setup, permissions auditing and the general operation and support of Microsoft 365 SharePoint Online
* Utilize scripting and automation to optimize workflow efficiency and enhance system performance within the Microsoft 365 environment
* Deploy, maintain, and configure company-issued personal computers using Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune), encompassing software deployment, patch management, and inventory tracking

 * Manage virtualization technologies such as VMware and Hyper-V
* Maintain and support databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL), ensuring data integrity, performance, and security
* Provide documentation and technical specifications to IT staff for planning and implementing new IT systems and infrastructure upgrades
* Oversee backup operations and establish suitable processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures
* Provide End users support, including hardware and software troubleshooting, documentation of issues and resolutions, as part of the helpdesk, and ensuring timely resolution of problems with minimal disruptions.


**Qualifications:**


* Associate or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field, or equivalent experience required
* 5+ years of system administration experience
* Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, Exchange, and SharePoint administration
* Advanced expertise in scripting languages and automation
* Proficiency in Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)
* Strong skills in hardware and software troubleshooting, issue documentation, and helpdesk support for end users
* System administration and IT certifications in Microsoft, or other network related fields are a plus


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Qualified applicants will be asked to complete a 30-minute online assessment as a part of your application.

title: Operational System Administrator/ Cloud Engineer
description:
**Operations System Administrator/ Cloud Engineer**
**iDoxSolutions**, a **B&A** company with a history dating back to 1993. We foster and embrace a distinct set of values that we live by and instill in all aspects of our organization: dedication, commitment, partnership, trust, and recognition. We have incorporated these values into successful delivery for our customers since 1993. We believe in ensuring the employees feel deeply connected to the organization, recognizing successes and hard work, and providing continuous opportunities to learn and grow.
Our people are entrepreneurial thinkers that combine mindset, vision, and experience to drive value – not only to us as an organization, but to the clients we support. Together we promote a collaborative culture with our clients, and with each other, as one team working towards a common vision. We would love for you to join our team!
**Job Summary**
iDoxSolutions has a requirement for an experienced Operations Systems Administrator to provide support for an established installation of an AppWorks/Content Server cloud-based application.
**Responsibilities**
* Monitor and maintain specific system operations.
* Deploy patches and new versions of software.
* Edit listing of SOPs and problem resolution logs.
* Provide feedback in lessons learned and implement changes.
* Record and document incidents and incident resolutions.
* Deploy and maintain thick- and thin-client applications.
* Train end-users on new features and processes.
* Troubleshoot end-user issues.
* Participate in planning, development and deployment meetings with development staff.
* Provide helpdesk and maintenance support to End-users.
* Detailed Knowledge of Amazon Web Services/ Gov Cloud and the ability to perform administrative maintenance and issue resolution.


**Education and Experience**
* BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science or other technical field.


**Required Skills**
* Requires knowledge of workflow processes, internal system operations and component services (file servers, db servers, AWS servers, process agents, internet servers, scan stations).
* Updating technical documentation for submission to approving teams as well as day-to-day maintenance of a cloud-based infrastructure.
* Knowledge to perform daily, weekly and periodic updates and maintenance operations to production, development and backup systems.
* Assist with operations related Helpdesk tickets, to answer questions and troubleshoot system, group and end-user issues.
* Experience with Basic system operations: member/group creation, worklist and document workflow monitoring, system health and space requirements.
* Ability to perform and check system backups.
* Familiarity and/or experience with the use of system logging & monitoring tools.
* Demonstrated experience with delivering web-based applications and dealing with the challenges of compatibility, scalability, and performance
* Familiarity with server, PC and NAS hardware and their maintenance
* Expertise in documenting administrative functions and processes
* Expertise in analyzing workflow solutions
* End-to-end understanding of development processes, organization, and techniques in order to drive the creation of optimal solutions
  

**Desired Skills**
* Experience Content Server/Livelink administration duties.
* Provide plans and schedules (MS Project) to program manager for identified projects.
* Ability to use standard problem solving techniques to diagnose system irregularities and problems.
* Knowledge of QA procedures.
* Provide test plans for new applications.
* Provide basic documentation/training materials for new applications.
* Ability to multi-task several issues simultaneously and rank according to severity.
* Ideally familiarity w PostgreSQL data functionality
* Ideally familiarity w Open Text products such as AppWorks and Content Server


**Basic Skills**
* Ability to research and report on a variety of issues: identified problem areas, potential problem areas, new hardware and software.
* Liaison with outside vendors of third-party software and hardware.
* Monitor contracts for technical support and maintenance.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Work under pressure and at speed to minimize the impact to end-users of system planned and unplanned issues.
* Willingness to learn system specifics.
* Ability to maintain a ‘toolbox’ of solutions and to recognized patterns in troubleshooting and helpdesk support.
* Maintain records and documentation of actions and procedures.
* Organizational skills.


**Security Clearance**
* **Ability to obtain a security clearance- Public Trust.**


**More About iDox:**
***Notable Clients***  

iDox has grown to be a company that is trusted by our clients for exceptional service, innovative solutions, and inspired employees. Our service extends through federal, state, and local Government, the private sector, and higher education. Some of our notable clients include Department of Justice, FDA and Army.
***Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion***
iDox affirms its long-standing commitment to maintain a diverse workforce reflective of the communities in which it operates, strives to maintain a business culture that recognizes the contributions and interests of diverse cultural and social groups, and seeks to maximize employee efforts by understanding individual differences and perspectives.
***Benefits and Programs***  

iDox is proud to offer full time employees a 100% premium paid medical plan option, which includes coverage for medical, prescription, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, disability, Teladoc, and accident insurance. In addition to these benefits, iDox employees enjoy paid time off, tuition assistance, iDox sponsored trainings and certifications, commuter transit benefits (SmartBenefits) for DC Metro full-time employees and a free subscription to a virtual exercise platform (NEOU).
iDox has launched several programs to focus on employee engagement, wellness, and assistance.
These include:
* The iDox Cares program: on-staff registered counselor, 30/60/90-day wellness check ins, personal development, financial management, and stress management seminars, wellness challenges, and more
* A formal mentorship program
* Job shadowing and cross training opportunities
* Brand Ambassador program
* Lifeworks Employee Assistance Program (EAP): engagement through guided wellness and peer recognition. Access to various support resources to include counseling, legal guidance, financial planning, and more
* Monthly virtual events
* iDox Annual Wellness Challenge: #StepWithiDox, #WalkDuringLunchWithiDox, #VolunteeringWithiDox, and #ExerciseDuringLunchWithiDox, and more


At iDox, we place significant importance on improving the communities and lives of citizens across the nation through our involvement, technology expertise, and employees. iDox puts an emphasis on charitable efforts in the Northern Virginia area, including Capital Area Food Bank pantry drives, book donations, Hope for Henry Foundation events, and many more. In recognition of all these efforts, iDox has been named a Companies as Responsive Employers (CARE) award recipient by Northern Virginia Family Services and nominated by the Northern Virginia Chamber of Commerce for Outstanding Corporate Citizenship Award.
**EEO**
iDox provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. iDox complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy covers conduct occurring at iDox’s offices, and other workplaces (including client sites) and all other locations where iDox is providing services, and to all work-related activities.
EEO is the Law
**Affirmative Action Plan**
As a federal government contractor and based on Executive Orders and applicable laws and regulations, iDox develops and maintains annual written Affirmative Action Plans and endeavors to hire and advance qualified minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans.
iDox participates in e-Verify. We provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s I-9 Form to confirm work authorization.

title: Workday Administrator
description:
Enterprise is a national nonprofit that exists to make a good home possible for the millions of families without one. We support community development organizations on the ground, aggregate and invest capital for impact, advance housing policy at every level of government, and build and manage communities ourselves. Since 1982, we have invested $54 billion and created 873,000 homes across all 50 states – all to make home and community places of pride, power and belonging.
Join us at enterprisecommunity.org.
Working at Enterprise
At Enterprise, you’ll be part of a diverse, committed team making a difference every day. You will collaborate with some of the smartest minds and biggest hearts in our field. You’ll be empowered to drive systems change and take bold steps to advance racial equity. And you will find a career home where you’re valued and supported in your growth journey.
Enterprise offers career opportunities in our offices across the country with an exceptional benefits package.
Job Description Summary
The ERP (Workday) Administrator is responsible for most transactional administration, procedural, and Level 0/1 configuration tasks, limited Level 2 across the ERP platform. This role will work closely with the Sr. Director of ERP and ERP team members in supporting security and reporting administration for internal and external customers, as well as various reporting, testing, and other projects or initiatives in our efforts to continually improve and enhance our use of our ERP (Workday). The ERP Administrator must be able to articulate and convey ERP(Workday) concepts in a manner that is easily consumable by end users and business stakeholders.  

  

To be successful in this role, you will strive to deliver exceptional customer service and will be a valued member of the ERP team and wider IT Division at Enterprise.
Job Description
Responsibilities:* Monitor, Triage/Manage incoming incidents and requests, and resolve tier 0, 1 and some tier 2 requests or system issues according to established guidelines, security policies, etc.
* Reporting- Develop and maintain basic custom reports and perform audits and annual maintenance using guidelines and policies
* Integrations-Monitor and manage integration warnings and failures using team guidelines and policies
* Security-serve as the primary security admin maintaining roles and permissions using guidelines and policies. Additionally, coordinate quarterly and annual security reviews and perform audits and maintenance as needed.
* Maintain technical documentation.
* Play an active role in your area of expertise, a point of reference for sharing knowledge and information with colleagues, collaborating to
* improve internal organizational capability, including training and mentoring of new Workday administrative users/team members
* Work directly with the business users, internal teams, and, as needed/directed vendors for both support and project work


Qualifications:* BA/BS Degree, in a technology related field or other related degree preferred.

A minimum of 5 years of experience with ERP solutions, primarily Workday; experience in any of the following* - system or functional configuration, reporting, security or integration preferred
* Strong verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team and leadership.
* Experience with ticketing systems (i.e. Service Now, JIRA, etc.) and knowledge of Agile SDLC and ITIL methodologies
* Ability to prioritize (and re-prioritize) as business needs change
* Experience working with a diverse set of stakeholders
* Excellent interpersonal skills and strong customer service orientation
* Strong analytical skills and an ability to learn technology tools quickly

Self-starter with the ability to work independently as well as with the team* -and understanding when each is the appropriate course of action.

*Total Rewards at* *Enterprise:* *You will be working with a group of talented professionals who are motivated by serving the community and addressing the need for affordable housing.* *Enterprise offers a comprehensive total rewards package for you and your family.* *The base salary for this role is $99,000 to $129,000, depending on level of skills and experience.* *The salary range for this position is represented by the low and high end of the range for the amount to be paid for the position. Salaries paid at Enterprise will vary based on factors that may include skills, education, location, experience, and performance. The salary range is just a part of the total rewards package provided to employees at Enterprise, and other rewards may include annual performance bonuses and generous paid leave* *programs.* *At Enterprise, our benefits form a major component of our total rewards package. Benefits include dental, health, and vision care plans, as well as family-building benefits, such as fertility, adoption, surrogacy support, and gender-affirming care. Enterprise allows flexible work arrangements to promote a better work-life balance. We offer health advocacy, EAP, and mental health benefits. We round out our total rewards package by offering financial education, wellness programs, and auto-enrollment in the company's 401(k) plan with employer matching contributions. Finally, you will have learning and development opportunities, including tuition reimbursement for job-related courses and* *certifications.* *Thank you for your interest in joining the Enterprise team in our effort and commitment to serve others.*
#LI-JW1 #ID

title: Splunk Administrator
description:
Premier International helps organizations unleash the full potential of their data. Our expertise in data-led business transformation, data fundamentals and migration, risk management and data value realization helps companies maximize the value of their data, empowering them to achieve success across the entire data value chain. Having successfully completed thousands of projects since our founding in 1985, many of the world's leading brands, technology companies, and system integrators rely on Premier to solve their most complex data challenges.


**The Opportunity:**
--------------------

Premier International is hiring an experienced **Splunk Administrator** to join our growing team in Chicago.



In this role, you will work directly with clients to understand their business needs, identify and define technical requirements, and become an expert with respect to their data. You will apply innovation, intelligence, and problem-solving skills to build custom solutions for their specific needs and guide them through large-scale technology transformations. You will benefit from mentorship and coaching from our industry experts. Travel throughout the United States, and sometimes internationally, is required for this position.



The ideal candidate for this role will be someone with experience working as a consultant, data analyst, business analyst, or similar role. This candidate will have a passion for using technology to design innovative solutions to address a never-ending stream of challenges on behalf of clients who have huge needs but lack the ability, experience, time, and/or tools to do it themselves


**What You'll Be Doing:**
-------------------------

* Supporting one of our large SaaS providers in maintaining their Splunk instances
* Creating, modifying, and deploying Splunk apps to facilitate the security log processing
* Monitoring the resource usage and the capacity of the Splunk instance closely can collaborate with the MonC team to scale up/down the cluster when necessary
* Troubleshooting Splunk performance issues and stability issues
* Provide technical support and answer questions from Splunk users.
* Work with customers and support to resolve bugs and support issues.
* Commitment and emphasis on operational excellence.
* *Note: The responsibilities for this position could expand to include other duties based on the needs of the company and the skills of the candidate.*

**What You'll Bring to the Team:**
----------------------------------


* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering with 5+ years of industry experience
* System administration experience and cluster administration experience on large-scale Splunk instances

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
**Linux System Administrator**

 **Job Location: 100% Remote**

 **Job Description:**


As a Linux systems administrator, you will manage, build, and troubleshoot physical and virtual servers using Red Hat Linux Operating Systems. Perform administrative operations and maintenance functions of linux server hardware and software. You will be responsible for deployment, configuration, and life cycle management of the Linux platforms. You will provide support for system hardening to DOD security standards.


An understanding of DoD and government security standards and policies are needed to ensure all deployed changes are highly secure and available.

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of systems administration experience working in an enterprise environment (DOD environment highly preferred).
* 5+ years of experience with Red Hat Linux systems administration and maintenance.
* Hands on experience with system hardening and implementation of DISA STIGs.
* Ability to work with stakeholders including management and development teams in defining requirements.
* Capable of interpreting vulnerability reports and defining executable actions that should be taken to reduce vulnerabilities and risks with proven ability to perform in-depth analysis on patch requirements, migrations in Linux environments, and build an action plan that will address vulnerabilities.
* Familiarity with VMWare and SAN management and concepts

**Typical Duties/Abilities:**

* Active Directory domain administration to include Group Policy deployment, management, and troubleshooting.
* Maintain system documentation and develop new documentation for system configurations, procedures, and best practices.
* Analyze and monitor system performance and capacity, proactively identifying and resolving issues.
* Validating and implementing critical system patches.
* Create, deploy, and administer file servers and shares for functionality in hybrid environments.
* Assist with network troubleshooting and resolutions on LAN and WAN connections.
* Assists with the scheduling, planning, and oversight of system upgrades.
* Assists in planning upgrades and replacements for program assets upon reaching their end-of-life cycle.
* Supports requirements gathering and asset acquisition for new programs of work.
* Supports team leadership as required and ensures customer requirements and project milestones are met.

**Soft Skills**

* Experience working with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Business Analysts)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills with a track record of taking solution ownership.
* Communication skills key! Demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate with leadership and key stakeholders.
* Ability to articulate design and configuration choices and bring about consensus.

**Education/Certifications:**

* BS degree in Information Technology or another related technical discipline.

**\\*\\*MUST BE A US CITIZEN AND BE ABLE TO COMPLETE THE GOVERNMENT'S BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION\\*\\***

title: Citrix Administrator
description:
Job Description :The Citrix Administrator’s role is to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the in-house information systems that support core organizational functions. This is achieved by monitoring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all networked software and associated operating systems. The Citrix Administrator will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.  
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  
1. Manage Citrix servers and their associated operating systems and software.  
2. Implement and support Citrix XenApp multiple environments  
3. XenApp configuration, Xen Desktop, Provisioning Server, and hypervisor and management experience (VMware)  
4. Administering Citrix Provisioning Services (PVS) 7.x or later versions  
5. Implement and support Group Policies  
6. Farm and Servers Reports / Maintenance  
7. Configure and support NetScaler and Access Gateway solutions to support scalable delivery of applications  
8. Collaborate with network staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.  
9. Monitor and test system performance; prepare and deliver system performance statistics and reports.  
10. Deploy new applications and enhancements to existing applications, software, and operating systems.  
11. Conduct research on software and systems products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.  
12. Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure system-related products and services.  
13. Design and perform server and security audits, system backup procedures, and other recovery processes in accordance with the company’s disaster recovery and business continuity strategies.  
14. Ensure system connectivity of all servers, shared software, groupware, and other applications.  
15. Create and maintain documentation as it relates to system configuration, mapping, processes, and service records.  
16. Check help desk database for entries on server and server resource issues; prioritize and respond to help desk tickets as appropriate.  
17. Manage enterprise directory services and supporting server infrastructure.  
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:

* Strong technical knowledge of most versions of Citrix up to 7/15 (primary focus on XenApp) as well as NetScaler experience in a large Citrixfarm environment
* Developed analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to take direction and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
* Other duties as assignedBasic Job Requirements :• Accredited four (4) year degree or global equivalent in applicable field of study and six (6) years of work-related experience or a combination of education and directly related experience equal to ten (10) years if non-degreed; some locations may have additional or different qualifications in order to comply with local requirements
* Ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and visitors
* Job related technical knowledge necessary to complete the job
* Ability to learn and apply knowledge of applicable local, state/province, and federal/national statutes and guidelines
* Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective mannerOther Job Requirements :Preferred Qualifications :• 7-10 years technical knowledge installing operating systems, third party software installation, upgrades and maintenance.
* 7-10 years technical knowledge installing, configuring and documenting hardware implementations.
* 5-7 years troubleshooting software/application issues with operating systems or third party products
* 5-7 years technical knowledge with security and system implementation following industry standards or Citrix XenDesktop/XenApp, CitrixStorefront, Citrix Studio, Citrix Director, Citrix Provisioning Services, Netscaler Access Gateway, Netscaler Unified Gateway, UCS blades, Windows, Hyper-V, VMware, Network, Storage, Cloud and Security platforms.
* 7-10 years technical knowledge of client/server and internet systems architectures.

BS in Computer Science- CCEE, CCIA certifications

title: Database Administrator
description:
Vista Innovative Services, LLC is seeking a Database Administrator to add to our Enterprise Analytics and Systems Support Services (EASSS) team in support of Human Resources Command (HRC) Enterprise Modernization Directorate (EMoD).
  
  

**Responsibilities Include:**  

* Designs, maintains, develops, implements, and administers Oracle, SQL, and Mainframe databases and its policies and procedures, ensuring its smooth operation, security, and integrity.
* Implement data models and database designs, data access, and table maintenance codes.
* Runs multiple computers and systems to check their accuracy and workability, and troubleshoots any errors found.
* Resolves database performance issues, database capacity issues, replication, and other distributed data issues.
* Overseeing the maintenance and security measures of databases; Oracle, SQL, or Mainframe.
* Monitor the following: performance, trend analysis, space usage, space usage trends, and security logs
* Ensure the accuracy, completeness and consistency of data supporting the systems and applications identified in the System Availability Standards and System and Application Laydown document.
* Supports the installation, configuration, upgrade, and migration of databases supporting application and systems
* Creating and maintaining data models, audit accounts, roles, and permissions, reporting and monitoring of system performance are functions performed within database administration
* Perform routine/daily production disk backups utilizing full backups, incremental backups, and transaction log files
* Monitor availability of production databases (respond to database alerts and resolve database issues). Outages shall be scheduled with the government to minimize impact on operations.
* Creating account data for authorized individuals to access databases, and organizing databases so individuals can find important documents in an efficient manner.
* Setting up cybersecurity measures, preserving data integrity, and ethically handling private data.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of database systems, including schema, configurations, and standard operating procedures.
* Generating regular reports on database performance, usage, and security compliance for management and stakeholders.
* Excellent attention to detail, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Education can be substituted with years of experience.
* 2-9 years of proven work experience as a Data Base Administrator.
* Strong knowledge of database management systems, such as Microsoft SQL Server, ETL, MySQL, Oracle, or Mainframe.
* Proficiency in wiring complex SQL queries and optimizing database performance.
* Certifications or Licenses in/or similar – CompTIA, Linux, etc.
* Secret Clearance

title: System Administrator
description:
**About us**

Thank you for considering employment opportunities with SoftOrbits. We kindly request that you refrain from submitting job applications via Indeed, as we are currently inundated with a high volume of messages through this platform, making it difficult to process them efficiently.

To ensure that your job application receives proper attention and consideration, we encourage you to submit it directly through our official website. Please follow these steps:

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Growth opportunities

* Administer and maintain network infrastructure, including both Windows and Linux systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance.
* Configure, install, and manage network hardware and software components, such as routers, switches, firewalls, and servers, to support organizational requirements.
* Monitor network activity, analyze performance data, and troubleshoot issues to identify and resolve network-related problems in a timely manner.
* Implement and maintain network security measures, including access controls, encryption, and intrusion detection systems, to protect against unauthorized access and data breaches.
* Collaborate with IT teams and departmental stakeholders to design and implement network solutions that meet business needs and align with strategic objectives.
* Document network configurations, procedures, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in network administration to continuously improve network infrastructure and operations.

**Experience:**

* Proficiency in administering and troubleshooting network devices and protocols, such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, and VPNs.
* Strong understanding of network security principles and practices, including firewalls, VPNs, encryption, and vulnerability management.
* Familiarity with virtualization technologies, cloud computing platforms, and containerization solutions is a plus.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills to work closely with team members and stakeholders.

title: System Administrator / Dev Ops
description:
**Description:**

The primary duties and job focus of this position will be to design, implement, and maintain all server systems and associated hardware and software and to manage these systems to ensure a reliable, secure and cost effective Information Technology infrastructure and operation. The Systems Administrator/Dev Ops will work with application developers to ensure proper design and functionality of servers and applications as well as automate processes using scripts, custom software, and web pages.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Information
* 3+ years of hands on experience and strong background in Linux systems administration, preferably with RedHat Enterprise, CentOS, and Ubuntu in addition to Microsoft Windows Server environments. Experience must include building and deploying servers, installing, maintaining, and patching Linux and Windows operating systems, and supporting production applications in a 24x7
* Strong working knowledge of complex web hosting configuration components, including firewalls, load balancers, web, and database servers
* Experience in a programming language and aptitude to learn new technologies as needed. C# experience preferred.
* Proficiency with and understanding of virtualization on an enterprise level, preferably using VMware ESX in addition to proficiency with Cloud server environment.
* Scripting and automation skills are an integral part of our environment. The ability to maintain, enhance and create tools to help in these areas is required.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversees the day-to-day operation of servers including hardware/software support, diagnostics, and special projects.
* Ensures 24/7 High Availability on all systems and applications.
* Collaborates with Software Engineers and provides technical and procedural direction regarding server design, database design and selection and other areas as needed and requested to ensure proper functionality of software applications and programs.
* Builds and maintains the servers and associated hardware and software required for development work, internal testing, customer testing and production environments.
* Documents, maintains, and enhances existing servers and associated hardware and software including, but not limited to: Local servers (physical and virtual) and remote servers and Applications.
* Analyzes and troubleshoots the server logs and tracks the nature and resolution of problems; monitors usage to ensure security of data and access privileges.

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator
description:
**Who We Are**

LeMans Corporation, the leading global distributor of motorcycle, snowmobile, ATV/UTV and personal watercraft parts and accessories headquartered in Janesville, Wisconsin has an immediate opening for a Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator.

LeMans Corporation promotes racing through its campaign WE SUPPORT THE SPORT®, helping to drive consumers to dealerships, while entertaining its dealers through hospitalities at the events it sponsors. LeMans Corporation d/b/a Parts Unlimited and Drag Specialties sells to over 20,000 dealerships worldwide. We continue to expand our service territory with our sister companies, Parts Canada, and Parts Europe.

**Overview**

The Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator assists the Senior System Administrator with monitoring D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds. This position performs D365 custom code deployments and other day to day system maintenance and administration of D365 as directed.

**Essential Functions**

* Performs D365 custom code deployments
* Assists Senior System Administrator with deployment of Microsoft scheduled releases
* Monitors & debugs Logic Apps to ensure integrations are functioning as expected
* Implements D365 security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds
* Monitors and collaborates on issues related to the D365 system
* Available during work hours through company’s communication channels: Outlook, Slack, Microsoft Teams
* Maintains strict confidentiality
* Performs other tasks and/or duties as assigned

**Non-Essential Functions**

* Performs Azure changes in conjunction with the Network support team that are impactful to D365
* Implements Azure security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the Azure environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds

**Required Qualifications and Education**

* Associates Degree required with a DevOps/Cloud computing focus preferred
* **1 or more of the following:**
* Microsoft Certificates: D365 Fundamentals (ERP), F&O Apps Dev Associate, or Finance Functional Consultant Associate
* Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) Azure
* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 systems/functional capabilities ​
* 1+ years of hands-on operational experience supporting Dynamics AX or D365 F&O ERP
* 2+ years of experience in building, monitoring, and maintaining Azure cloud environments
* Good working knowledge of MS tools such as Azure DevOps, Lifecycle Services, and Visual Studio

**Physical Demands**

Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 7+ hours
* Must be mobile within an office space to access office equipment
* Must be able to communicate verbally and written
* Must be able to read from a screen

**Disclaimer**

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

LeMans Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. title: Security Administrator
description:
**Position Mission**



The Security Administrator is responsible and accountable for oversight, design, and management of the Parasol Managed Security program. This role will ensure that Parasol MSSP clients receive all contracted security services in line with the promised schedule. Contracted Security services currently include end user awareness testing and training, penetration testing, and HIPAA security auditing. This position works closely with other departments to ensure security standards are met, both internally and in client environments.


**Responsibilities**



* Management and delivery of the primary Managed Security Services provided to all MSSP clients
* Developing and maintaining comprehensive policies and procedures relating to the Managed Security program
* Initial research and response planning for newly discovered vulnerabilities that could potentially impact multiple clients
* This includes delegating tasks and deadlines to respective departments to ensure the response plan is met
* Working closely with other departments to establish or update current security standards
* This role will be responsible for ensuring all standards are documented and centrally available.
* Each department is primarily responsible for their own standards; however, this role will have input and the ability to suggest adds or changes as necessary.
* Routine auditing to ensure security standards are in place as defined by the respective departments
* This role is responsible for creating the audit schedule and delegating tasks and deadlines to other departments to ensure the audits get completed in line with the schedule.
* Working closely with other departments on vulnerability resolution plans based on results received from MSSP services



**Requirements**



* Healthcare experience preferred; long-term healthcare support experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of systems or network administration experience in an enterprise environment.
* At least 5 years’ experience working with systems or network design, configuration, and management with a focus on security
* Experience with multiple enterprise or network systems or technologies such as Active Directory, Microsoft Server, Windows Operating Systems, file shares, printers and copiers, phone systems, Exchange, routers, switches, firewalls, routing, VPN, desktop hardware support, network support, application support, etc.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills are required.
* The position is largely self-motivated and self-structured. The right candidate will be driven to be challenged and to succeed.

title: Principal Subcontracts Administrator (Remote)
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented **Principal Subcontracts Administrator** to join our team! In this role you will get to independently administer and manage one or more subcontracts of unlimited dollar value to ensure that subcontractors fully meet Company and project requirements.


**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Prepares recommended source lists of qualified subcontractors, drawing upon their past performance experience and coordinates the list with project management and client recommendations.
* Prepares Request for Proposal form and verifies accuracy and completeness of proposal packages. Interfaces with affected sections to clarify and ensure that all necessary data has been included.
* Receives subcontractors' responses to requests for proposals, determines each subcontractor's ability to meet Company and project requirements, and negotiates the terms and conditions. Prepares and issues contracts commensurate with delegated procurement authority.
* Prepares subcontract documents and amendments, including identification and inclusion of flowdown requirements from the prime contract. Ensures that terms and conditions will be appropriate.
* Prepares reports and contractual correspondence for project management and client. Establishes and maintains accurate tracking records tailored to each subcontract.
* Maintains and updates subcontractors' files to include records of payment.
* Performs subcontract closeout actions, completes file documentation, and forwards subcontract files to storage. Ensures retention of hard copy of reports and claims for seven years.
* Provides technical guidance to lower-level Subcontract Administrators. May make assignments, review work, and offer training in subcontracting procedures. May give input toward performance evaluations and salary increase recommendations.
* Serves as liaison between subcontractor and procurement personnel.
* Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.
* A willingness to travel to the subcontractor's facility when necessary is required.

**What Required Skills You'll Bring:**

* 4-year degree in Business Administration (or related field) and 10-12 years of related work experience involving defense contracting, Supply Chain Management/subcontract administration, procurement, negotiations, proposal preparation and bid analysis with the US Government and a combination of commercial, state, local government, or international clients.
* An extensive knowledge of subcontracting activities typical to the engineering and construction industry. In addition, excellent written and oral communications skills, an ability to effectively negotiate subcontracts, as well as proven ability to perform in a lead capacity.
* Must understand the government acquisition process and Working knowledge of FAR/DFAR and Public Laws relating to subcontracting, General Services Administration Acquisition Regulation (GSAR), and Truth in Negotiations (TINA).
* Ability to lead and confidently support Request for Proposal (RFP) and review meetings, contract pre-award meetings, final negotiations, and draft/finalization of contract, to include performing risk analysis of RFPs (identify risks and prepare mitigation strategies) and providing input for pricing strategies, prepare formal contract correspondence and ensure compliance with contract policies, procedures, and standard operating practices to provide successful proposal and contract execution.
* Ability to counsel management, provide leadership in developing and communicating new concepts; apply them accurately throughout an evolving environment; organize, schedule and coordinate multiple work phases; determine the appropriate approach at the task or project level.
* Knowledge of negotiating various contract types, including Firm Fixed-Price (FFP), Firm-Fixed-Price Level-of-Effort (FFP LOE), Cost-plus-fixed-fee (CPFF) Term and Level of Effort (LOE), Time and Materials (T&M), and Indefinite-Delivery, Indefinite-Quantity (IDIQ), Government-wide Acquisition Contracts (GWACs), Contract types and Subcontract Administration from “Cradle to Grave”
* Experience in CPSR Audit requirements, File Documentation, and Price Analysis Techniques
* US Citizenship required.

**What Desired Skills You'll Bring:**

* Experience with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Costpoint Purchasing System.

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None

title: Systems Administrator, Junior
description:
Systems Administrator, Junior**The Opportunity:**


Your combination of people skills and system administrator expertise makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting our team, clients, and mission? We’re looking for a system administrator who is fluent in Windows Server Administration, basic networking knowledge, and exhibits strong communication skills to help us further enhance our remote development lab capabilities.


As a system administrator on our team, you’ll facilitate account setup and management, system configuration management, and security best-practice implementation. You’ll learn how to help clients overcome challenges through monitoring and performance management. You’ll analyze problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network.


You’ll combine your technical knowledge and communication skills to turn metrics into information and articulate their meaning. This is an opportunity to gain experience with VMWare Horizon and enhance Scripting and Automation to foster the automation of routine tasks and to help streamline processes. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve the remote lab capabilities.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

**You Have:**

* Experience in Windows Server Administration, configuring and managing Windows Server operating systems
* Experience with Active Directory, including setting up and managing domain controllers
* Experience with security concepts and best practices, including user permissions, access controls, and encryption
* Knowledge of setting up and managing file shares on Windows servers
* Knowledge of Group Policy management for configuring and controlling user and computer settings
* Knowledge of backup strategies and recovery procedures for both Windows servers and virtual machines
* Knowledge of tools and techniques for monitoring system performance and making necessary optimizations
* Ability to deploy, configure, and manage virtual machines using VMware vSphere
* Ability to obtain a security clearance
* HS diploma or GED

**Nice If You Have:**

* Experience with VMware Horizon for virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) setup and management
* Experience with Scripting and Automation tools, including PowerShell, to automate routine tasks and streamline processes
* Ability to diagnose and resolve issues related to Windows servers and VMware infrastructure
* Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills for collaborating with team members, documenting processes, and providing support
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physical Science

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

**Create Your Career:**

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

**Your Candidate Journey**


At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

**Compensation**


At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
