title: Senior Database Administrator
description:
Join us as a **Database Administrator** on our **Ginesys** **Tech team** in our **Kolkata** office to get the opportunity to do the best work of your career and make a profound impact in our journey of enabling retail in India.
**What You’ll Achieve:**

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Database Administrator (DBA) specializing in PostgreSQL to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing cloud database instances, ensuring their performance, security, and availability. The DBA will play a crucial role in maintaining the health and efficiency of our database environments while providing technical support and guidance to internal stakeholders.
**Your Responsibilities:**
* Deployment, Operational Management and Monitoring for Postgres database instances (self-hosted or DBaaS).
* Conduct capacity planning exercises for database instances to ensure optimal resource allocation.
* Monitor index efficiency and perform maintenance tasks to optimize database performance.
* Ensure round-the-clock monitoring of database instances to promptly address any issues or anomalies.
* Perform table maintenance tasks and optimize vacuum settings to improve database performance.
* Configure real-time alerting systems to promptly notify relevant stakeholders of critical issues.
* Customize alert thresholds as per specific requirements to ensure relevant and timely notifications.
* Proactively attend alerted issues and manage escalations if required to minimize downtime.
* Provide guidance on query optimization techniques to enhance database performance.
* Implement table partitioning strategies to improve manageability and performance.
* Configure user/group security settings and maintain security best practices to safeguard database assets.
* Evaluate database releases and recommend paths for upgrading and patching to ensure system stability and security.
* Apply database and tools version upgrades and patches to keep systems up to date.
* Set up point-in-time recovery mechanisms as needed to enable data recovery in case of emergencies.
* Provide guidance and implement disaster recovery planning to minimize data loss and downtime in the event of disasters.
* Verify production backups regularly to ensure data integrity, data availability and the fitness of the data recovery processes.
* Establish and maintain development/test environments aligned with production environments to support testing and development activities.
* Maintain high availability architecture, including one or more read-replicas, to ensure uninterrupted access to critical data.
* Advise on read scalability and load balancing strategies to optimize performance and resource utilization.
* Conduct status meetings and generate reports on ongoing environment health and activities on a weekly basis to keep stakeholders informed.
* Perform trend analysis on capacity/space, load, and lag on a monthly basis to identify patterns and potential issues.
* Conduct quarterly strategic reviews on trends, uptime, business alignment, and opportunities for continuous improvement.
* Conduct comprehensive performance optimization activities, including proactive health scans and annual database tune-ups, to enhance system performance.
* Design and perform database parameter tuning both initially and on an ongoing basis to optimize system performance.

  

**Essential Requirements:**
* Proven experience as a Database Administrator with expertise in PostgreSQL.
* In-depth knowledge of database management and optimization techniques.
* Familiarity with monitoring and management tools such as EDB Postgres Enterprise Manager (PEM).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

  

**Desirable Requirements:**
* Relevant PostgreSQL certifications (From EDB or any other renowned institution) are a plus.


**Benefits:**

We like to think that talent grows at Ginesys and stays at Ginesys. To ensure this, we provide our employees with the best working environment, the latest technology and continuous support. We go out of our way to retain the small business feeling with which we started and stimulate innovation and collaboration through teamwork and our non-hierarchical approach. We offer competitive salary, and other fantastic perks and benefits, such as:
* Ginesys Academy for holistic training and development
* Comprehensive health insurance coverage
* Excellent rewards and recognition policy
* Transparent compensation policy with no unnecessary deduction in CTC
* Annual company off-site and a variety of events, celebrations throughout the year
* Travelling opportunities between our offices across the country.
* Annual Ginesys walkathon & related sporting events
* Quarterly Coffee with CEO
* and more!


**Here’s our story; now tell us yours:**

“Ginesys One” is India’s best omni retail suite backed by Ginesys, the first integrated Retail specific ERP software for online retail, offline retail and distribution. It is the largest Indian company in the retail tech industry catering to both online and offline needs. 1200 + brands including (Manyavar, V-Mart, Skechers) are accelerating their businesses with Ginesys. With a team of 400+ employees, Ginesys One plans to revolutionise retail by being a single-stop cloud-based retail suite.

We have a pan India presence with offices in major cities including Gurgaon, Kolkata, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Coimbatore & Goa and are expanding rapidly. We love the challenges of retail and are busy solving them to create a great retail tech suite.

Ginesys core mission is to continue to build world-class internal service capabilities, in a bid to deliver outstanding external service value to customers. We are an ISO-certified and SOC compliant company having won myriad awards for our innovation and support. For further information, please visit our website http://ginesys.in

title: Senior Database Developer
description:
**Role** - **Cloud Database Engineer III - IN** **Skills - Oracle** ( Primary ), MySQl & PostgreSQL ( Secondary )+ Cloud **Timings** - *Should be ok to work in permanent night shift* **Job Profile Summary**
The Database Administrator Perform database engineering and administration activities including design, planning, configuration, monitoring, automation, self- serviceability, alerting, and space management, database backup and recovery. Plan computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long- range requirements, operational guidelines, and protection with a capacity to lead and advise on migration and modernization, discover, and execute workload migrations to Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP). **Knowledge List**  

1. **7+ yrs of Administration** experience with following Database engines
(i) **Oracle**(ii) MySQL
(iii) PostgreSQL  

  

Ability to Deploy, Manage and Troubleshoot HADR config in one of the following tech buckets SQL Server (Always On, FCI, Loshipping, Replication) or Oracle(RAC, Data guard, Golden Gate) , MySQL & PostgreSQL( Master slave replication, InnoDB cluster Set)  

 2. **Cloud Platform:*** Hand’s on with using cloud tech tools such as AWS DMS, SMS, App Migration Service, Migration Hub, Azure Migrate, Data Migration Service, SQL Server DMA, Azure ASR, AWS DRS

* Migration from SQL server to/from Other RDBMS platform for PaaS models like AWS Aurora, AWS RDS, Azure Database, Azure MI, GCP Cloud SQL.

* Understanding Cloud basics and perform duties like security management, storage management, Backup Vaults, Key vaults, Server/DB Monitoring

* Knowledge of deploying and managing databases in cloud platforms such as Azure SQL Database or/and Amazon RDS or/and GCP Cloud SQL

  

3. **Performance Monitoring and Query Optimization:*** Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL queries and stored procedures.
* Understanding of query execution plans and query tuning techniques.
* Understanding of performance tuning methodologies, indexing strategies, and statistics management.
* Understanding of monitoring tools and techniques for identifying and addressing performance issues.

  

4. **Backup and Recovery:**
Proficiency in database backup and recovery concepts, including full, differential, and transaction log backups  

5. **Troubleshooting Skills:*** Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot common database-related problems such as connectivity issues, query performance, performance bottlenecks and data corruption.

  

6. **HA&DR:*** Familiarity with High Availability and Disaster Recovery concepts and understanding the significance of RTO and RPO.

  

7 **Database Upgrades and Migrations:*** Understand the process of upgrading Database Server to newer versions and migrating databases to new servers and Migrating databases to Cloud platforms.

 **Education Requirements List*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or a directly related fieldR

 **Certifications List*** Database Specialty Certifications in AWS/Azure.
* Cloud Associate/Professional Certification
  

**About Rackspace Technology**
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.  

**More on Rackspace Technology**
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Software Architect
description:
Location: Mumbai, India
Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.
Present in India since 1953, Thales is headquartered in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, and has operational offices and sites spread across Bengaluru, Delhi, Gurugram, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Pune among others. Over 1800 employees are working with Thales and its joint ventures in India. Since the beginning, Thales has been playing an essential role in India’s growth story by sharing its technologies and expertise in Defence, Transport, Aerospace and Digital Identity and Security markets.**Job Description : Solution Architect, APAC**


The position is for “Solution Architect, APAC” role based out of Mumbai and we are looking for a stalwart who owns this domain, in the space of Identity & Access Management. The Solution Architect is required to engage with the customers to explain the Thales IAM solution-set applicable to the specific customer/vertical/domain, customize the positioning of the solution as per their specific needs, create and handle existing and new large opportunities in the region.


The “Solution Architect” is also expected to support existing customer base in Mumbai/India technically. This would need him/her to closely collaborate with Sales, Marketing & Partners. The “Solution Architect” would need to be super effective in working directly with the customers & partners with an emphasis on unsurpassed customer satisfaction and timely response to customer/partner feedback.


This is a new position considering the success we are seeing the region & it reports to Sales Engineering Manager, APAC.

**Responsibilities**

* Position Thales IAM portfolio as a solution convincingly to the customers & partners in the region. Thales IAM portfolio having coverage in the areas of WIAM, CIAM, Digital Banking, HW & SW Authenticators (FIDO/Passkeys/PKI/OTP) and their management platforms would need to be stitched as a solution to be understood and received well by the customers & partners.
* More product/solution details can be seen at


The candidates are expected to come prepared with their understanding of Thales IAM portfolio/solutions.

* Assist sales team to identify, qualify and quantify all opportunities within your assigned region and lead sales effort.
* Pre-sales technical support for your assigned products.
* Provide field support on critical post-sales support issues to achieve unsurpassed customer satisfaction.
* Work with sales team to develop and enhance customer and partner relationships.
* Create and deliver accurate and technically correct sales presentations and proposals both directly to end users and partners.
* Be involved in communication with customers and partners on product changes, product upgrades and product innovations.
* Provides feedback and marketing intelligence to sales team and product marketing team to ensure company’s products remain competitive in the market.
* Participate and represent Thales CPL at appropriate user conferences and trade shows.
* Provides weekly reports on SE activities and other duties assigned.

 **Requirement**

* University degree in Management Information System, Computing or similar subject.
* Minimum 5 years of technical experience in IT industry with at least 2 years in a customer facing role.
* Ability to develop and enhance customer/partner relationships.
* Consultative selling skill, capable of discovering customer pains and proposing solutions.
* Good presentation skill, capable to articulate technical proposals to decision makers at both technical and business levels (from IT administrator to CISO).
* Capable of working independently under sales objectives assigned by regional sales director.
* Good interpersonal skills, self-motivated and a good team player.
* Willing to take challenging work.
* Comfortable with travelling 35% of the time within Asia.
* Knowledge of solution integration and application development, although programming will not necessarily be part of the duty.

**Highly Desirable Technical Skills and Experiences:**

* Understanding of authentication and authorization concepts.
* Experience with MFA, IGA, IAM, CIAM and PAM solutions.
* Experience with CIAM and API-based design/deployment.
* Experience with SAML, SCIM, OAuth, OpenID, as well as general networking technologies including HTTP/S, SSL/TLS, TCP/IP, RADIUS, Firewall, Proxy...etc.
* Knowledge on Microsoft AD on-premises, Azure AD, LDAP, Single sign on (SSO), Federated Identities and database technologies.
* Experience with and certificate based authentication, Cryptographic APIs like PKCS#11, MS CAPI/CNG.
* Experience with one of the major cloud providers (Google Cloud, Azure, AWS) as well as Docker/Kubernetes/Openshift.
* Deployment of web servers, application servers and database servers as well as experience in Windows and Linux operating systems.
* Relevant security or professional certifications are beneficial; CISSP, CISM, etc.


At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

title: Lead Analyst
description:
About us
HMH is a leading provider of drilling solutions, offering a wide range of products and services that are designed to be the safest and most efficient in the industry. Apart from our expertise in land and offshore operations, we are continuously expanding our knowledge within subsea mining, geothermal, onshore and offshore construction, as well as offshore wind industries. With offices in 16 countries across five continents, HMH maintains a strong global presence.  

  

HMH is a frontrunner in developing and providing automation and digital solutions for our drilling customers to support their endeavor to improve efficiency and environmental footprint. Equipped with its brilliant team of engineers, HMH is committed to actively exploring opportunities in other industries. For us, this means new opportunities and challenges that we need creativity and great minds to solve in our efforts to innovate our future.
Do you want to join our team?
At HMH we value our employees. We offer exciting job opportunities that will give you the opportunity to grow in your role and give you the professional development you deserve. In addition to competitive pay and benefits, you will join a casual and inclusive work environment. Our environment is based on respect and having a good day at work, so you can expect to join a knowledgeable, global team who help each other to succeed.
Summary
Recognized as a SME within the company the Azure Cloud Systems Administrator role requires in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own job discipline and broad knowledge of other job disciplines within the organization function. Solves unique problems that have a broad impact on the business. Regarded as the technical expert in their job discipline within the organization. Anticipates business and regulatory issues; recommends product, process or service improvements.
Job Responsibilities* Provide implementation, configuration, and maintenance for the organization’s Azure Cloud Platform.
* Hands-on provisioning, configuration, and maintenance of Azure Cloud services and infrastructure.
* Administer Azure Cloud PaaS, IaaS and SaaS services/systems and manage Azure Virtual Desktop.
* Maintain all Cloud management functions to include all facets of system and storage administration tasks, Cloud Management, documentation, backups, cost management and integration of on-premises systems into the Cloud.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve Azure server, certificate, and SQL database issues
* Maintain patch levels in accordance with organizational policy to ensure security services in the Azure Cloud environment is in compliance


Required Qualifications
Education:* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college or high school diploma/GED with at least 5 years of professional experience in IT.


Experience:* 8+ years of progressive Systems Administration experience with at least 2 years working with AWS or Microsoft Azure Cloud technologies.


Skills and Abilities:* Certification in at least two relevant technologies (MCSA Server, VMware VCP, Microsoft Certified Azure Cloud Administrator, Microsoft Certified Azure Cloud DevOps Engineer).
* Extensive background and experience with Active Directory, Azure AD, Hyper-V, Virtualization.
* Working knowledge and understanding of SQL Database and server interoperability concepts.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent analytical thinking skills.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Job Location :** Ahmedabad, Gujarat


**Experience :** 5 to 7 Years


**Roles and responsibilities :**

+ Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement custom Salesforce applications.
+ Develop high-quality code using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce technologies.
+ Customize and extend Salesforce applications using declarative tools such as Process Builder, Flow, and Lightning App Builder.
+ Integrate Salesforce with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs, web services, and middleware tools.
+ Perform code reviews, mentor junior developers, and ensure best practices are followed throughout the development lifecycle.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement solutions to optimize performance and scalability.
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest Salesforce releases, features, and best practices, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our Salesforce platform.

**Requirements:**

+ Minimum of six years of experience developing Salesforce applications, with a strong focus on Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Components.
+ Salesforce certifications such as Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I/II, Salesforce Certified Administrator, or Salesforce Certified App Builder are highly preferred.
+ Proven experience with Salesforce integration patterns, web services, and API development.
+ Strong understanding of Salesforce data model, security model, and declarative features.
+ Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
+ Strong problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a passion for delivering high-quality solutions.
+ Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Perks and Benefits:**+ Healthy & Flexible Work Environment
+ All Saturdays Off (5 Days Working)
+ Performance based Incentive & employee friendly policies
+ Attractive Awards, Festival Celebrations, Picnic, Birthday Celebrations etc.
+ Unlimited opportunity to grow.

title: IT Engineer
description:
**Job Summary**

As a member of the Data Center Services Operation team, the Operations Engineer will be responsible for carrying out activities that combine analytical and design skills with adequate knowledge of software and hardware technology to define, design, implement, test, deploy, and modify Emerson's VMware/Virtualization, Storage, Data Protection, Windows, and Linux infrastructure to produce and implement functional solutions that meet predefined requirements or organizational needs. This person will also be responsible for administering, monitoring, maintaining performance, ensuring security, applying patches, and fixing the infrastructure


* Installing, configuring, and maintaining hardware, operating systems, and software applications on servers. Supporting VMware/Virtualization, Cloud, Storage, Data Protection, Windows, and Linux infrastructure, including all related administration aspects.
* Performing periodic system maintenance tasks, including software updates, patches, and firmware upgrades.
* Monitoring system performance, resource utilization, and capacity planning.
* Resolving hardware and software issues in a timely manner.
* Performing periodic patching and applying appropriate security updates.
* Establishing and adhering to backup and disaster recovery procedures.
* Work on multiple cloud environment (Microsoft Azure, Oracle Cloud etc.) to manage infrastructure.
* Managing user accounts, permissions, and access control.
* Providing technical support and assistance in troubleshooting customer issues.
* Evaluating and recommending system upgrades, new technologies, and software/hardware solutions.
* Planning and implementing system migrations, integrations, and expansions.
* Collaborating with vendors and IT team members to implement new systems and technologies.
* Creating and maintaining documentation, including system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
* Generating reports on system performance, incidents, and security events.
* Collaborating with other IT team members, such as network administrators, database administrators, and developers.
* Keeping up-to-date knowledge of emerging technologies, trends, and standard methodologies in system administration.
* Ensuring compliance with company audit and security policies and procedures.
* Developing and implementing scripts and automation tools for repetitive administrative tasks.
* Automating system maintenance tasks and monitoring processes.
* Improving system efficiency and productivity through scripting and automation.
* Diagnosing and resolving hardware and software issues for VMware/Virtualization, Storage, Data Protection, Windows, and Linux infrastructure.
* Supporting x86 blade servers and rack-mountable servers. Installing, fixing, and replacing hardware and firmware as needed.
* Advancing complex issues to the appropriate teams or vendors when necessary.
* Using change and incident management systems to ensure enterprise-level system availability.
* Performing any other tasks assigned by the direct supervisor or management related to job responsibilities or legal compliance.

**Who You Are:**

You show a tremendous amount of initiative in tough situations; are exceptional at spotting and seizing opportunities. You observe situational and group dynamics and select best-fit approach. You make implementation plans that allocate resources precisely. You pursue everything with energy, drive, and the need to finish.


**For This Role, You Will Need:**

* 4+ year of demonstrated ability in **Windows server administration,** including installation, configuration, and maintenance of Windows servers (Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019,2022) with specialized knowledge and practical experience in **Cloud Services** and Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) environments.
* Demonstrated expertise in **Citrix virtualization solutions** , including practical experience with Citrix App and Desktop for application and desktop virtualization.
* Familiarity with **cloud services** such as virtual machines, storage, networking, identity, and access management (IAM), and monitoring services in cloud platforms.
* Demonstrated expertise in cloud platforms such as **Microsoft Azure, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure** including practical experience with provisioning, configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting resources in cloud environments.
* Experience with **PowerShell scripting for automation and management** of Windows environments.
* Hands-on experience with cloud monitoring, logging, and performance tuning tools.
* Experience working in an operational IT environment that applies ticketing and problem management systems (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira) for incident and changes.
* Experience working in an operational IT environment that applies ticketing and problem management systems (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira) for incident and changes.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to solve complex technical issues in a Windows and cloud environment.
* Superb communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**

* Certification(s) in cloud technologies (e.g., Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator, AWS Certified Solutions Architect) and/or Windows server administration (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Windows Server) is a plus.
* Knowledge of hybrid cloud architectures and solutions for integrating on-premises and cloud environments.

**Our Offer to You:**

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.


Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be **driven within the industry and local labor markets** . We also offer a **comprehensive medical and insurance coverage** to meet the needs of our employees.


We are committed to creating a global workplace that **supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion** . We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our **Work Authorization Sponsorship** .


We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all **employees can reach their greatest potential** . We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.


We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote **Work-Life Balance** through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.


Safety is paramount to us, and we are steadfast in our pursuit to provide a **Safe Working Environment** across our global network and facilities.


Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion


At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.


This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.


If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.


  
**WHY EMERSON**

**Our Commitment to Our People**

**At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.**

**We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.**

**At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.**

**Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation**

**If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact:** **idisability.administrator@emerson.com** **.**

**ABOUT EMERSON**

**Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.**

**With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.**

**We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!**

**No calls or agencies please.**

title: Engineer
description:
A Digital Workspace Endpoints Engineer is an experienced and accomplished expert contributing to a dynamic, infrastructure design team making a difference. The position’s primary technology focus is on endpoints management. The goal is to execute architectural directives and ensure 24x7x365 virtual infrastructure availability for an energy efficient semiconductor company. The Digital Workspace Endpoints Engineer role requires versatility along with initiative. The ideal candidate will know how to think “outside-the-box” and will share in responsibilities implementing, enhancing, and supporting the provisioning, configuration and management of endpoints via Microsoft Intune and Configuration Manager. The Digital Workspace Engineer will work closely with architects, infrastructure team members, and application developers. Adhering to industry best practices to support onsemi’s business objectives and user community experience is of utmost importance.


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Day to day administration of Intune environment to include engineering new solutions as needed
* Desktop application management and deployment
* Endpoints client management
* Creating and updating technical documentation as required
* Mentors and assists global Service Desk support team
* Tier 3 escalation for investigating, troubleshooting, and resolving complex Intune related issues in production
* Capacity planning to provide analysis and decision support modeling
* Monitoring, ongoing performance tuning, resource optimization, and delivering improvement recommendations to respective infrastructure teams
* Passionate about cloud computing technologies, understanding business drivers, and emerging trends
* Executes efficient life cycle management methodologies of Intune, endpoints management with an “automation only” mindset
* Experience with hybrid cloud solutions (automation and orchestration, cloud management, cloud native apps)
* Experience generating useful report metrics and analytics on the health of Endpoints
* Coordinates meetings and communicates with non-technical staff on project requests
* Ensures compliance to IT general controls and company working rules

**REQUIREMENTS:**

Years of experience: Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Microsoft Intune Management  



Education: Bachelor's degree (or equivalent work experience) from a regionally accredited institution in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Information Sciences, Information Technology, or Software Engineering  



Certification: At least one, preferably two or more of the following certifications: Microsoft Intune, VCAP; Microsoft MSCE, Microsoft Azure Administrator  



Communication: Fluent English (written and verbal)


**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

* A minimum of 5+ years in an enterprise Information Technology (IT) environment
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Intune Microsoft365, Windows 11 (incl. WVD/VDI), Intune, SCCM, Office 365, Enterprise Mobility + Security (EMS), Teams, etc.
* Microsoft Office 365 Security, Azure ATP, DLP, AIP, Windows Defender ATP, Azure AD, Azure AD PIM
* PowerShell and other scripting language
* Up-to-date knowledge of Microsoft products
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Technical documentation is a requirement of the position
* Ability to establish and maintain effective excellent working relationships at all levels
* Comfortable multitasking and working in a fast-paced environment across multiple projects of varying complexity
* Self-motivated with the ability to work with minimal supervision
* Must be able to visualize and articulate project parameters and scope of work
* Strong analysis and problem-solving ability
* Proficiency with Microsoft Active Directory
* Highly self-motivated and directed with a keen attention to detail and willingness to assume responsibility
* An openness to see problems or issues from various angles and a willingness to discuss and vet solutions until a common goal or idea is agreed upon
* Flexibility to adapt and adjust as required until the business needs are met
* Strong understanding of systems architecture from the application through infrastructure stack
* Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.

  
**onsemi** (Nasdaq: ON) is driving disruptive innovations to help build a better future. With a focus on automotive and industrial end-markets, the company is accelerating change in megatrends such as vehicle electrification and safety, sustainable energy grids, industrial automation, and 5G and cloud infrastructure. With a highly differentiated and innovative product portfolio, onsemi creates intelligent power and sensing technologies that solve the world’s most complex challenges and leads the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world.  

  

  

More details about our company benefits can be found here:
https://www.onsemi.com/careers/career-benefits
  
We are committed to sourcing, attracting, and hiring high-performance innovators, while providing all candidates a positive recruitment experience that builds our brand as a great place to work.

title: Senior Risk Analyst
description:
**Line of Service**

Advisory
**Industry/Sector**

Not Applicable
**Specialism**

Data, Analytics & AI
**Management Level**

Associate
**Job Description & Summary**

A career within Data and Analytics services will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations uncover enterprise insights and drive business results using smarter data analytics. We focus on a collection of organisational technology capabilities, including business intelligence, data management, and data assurance that help our clients drive innovation, growth, and change within their organisations in order to keep up with the changing nature of customers and technology. We make impactful decisions by mixing mind and machine to leverage data, understand and navigate risk, and help our clients gain a competitive edge.
  

  

Our team helps clients navigate various analytics applications to get the most value out of their technology investment and foster confidence in their business intelligence. As part of our team, you'll help our clients implement enterprise content and data management applications that improve operational effectiveness and provide impactful data analytics and insights.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.


As an Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:


* Invite and give in the moment feedback in a constructive manner.
* Share and collaborate effectively with others.
* Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise.
* Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.
* Follow risk management and compliance procedures.
* Keep up-to-date with developments in area of specialism.
* Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in the materials I produce.
* Build and maintain an internal and external network.
* Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms.
* Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.

The role would primarily be focused primarily on working on Security Configuration of a Salesforce Org and secondarily on Salesforce Org Security Assessments.


Working as a Associate, expected to work in a team of 8-12 people for multiple projects in the area of Security Configuration for Salesforce.


The various tasks include:


* Leveraging Salesforce Shield (Platform Encryption, Audit Trails, Event Monitoring & Einstein Data Detect)
* Implement Data Masking, Security & privacy framework for the applications
* Apart from configuration candidate should be good in customization which includes Apex, Aura and Lightning Web Components
* Good to have cross platform integration experience
* Implementing SSO, Encryption, Auth. Providers and Authorization protocols

**Knowledge Preferred:**

* Extensive experience in Force.com platform using APEX and Visualforce
* SOQL,SOSL
* Must have Field service Lightning tool configuration experience.
* Experience with SFDX, Aura, Git, REST, and Middleware/ETL/ESB is highly preferred.
* Salesforce Platform App Builder, Platform Developer 1, Administrator certifications.

Experience with VS Code, JSON, HTML, CSS, Ajax, JavaScript , JQuery


* Experience with Gitlab/GitHub/Bitbucket, and SDLC
* Experience with Systems Integrations through Apex
* Demonstrates thorough knowledge of the design, implementation, and/or assessment of Security, including a significant understanding of the systems implementation lifecycle, including configuring and optimizing business process controls and application security.
* Demonstrates thorough understanding of business processes related to Salesforce.
* Able to handle data management inclusive of data load, data translation, data hygiene, data migration and integration.
* Proven ability to look at technical processes from a strategic standpoint and understand the inter-relationships

**Capability:**

* Demonstrates thorough ability to adapt a work program and practice aid, as well as perform assessments, using PwC's proprietary or other relevant tools to evaluate controls, security, SOD, and potential for optimization.
* Demonstrates thorough abilities to identify and address client needs, including developing and sustaining meaningful client relationships and understanding of the client's business.
* Demonstrates thorough knowledge of designing and execution of test scripts for Salesforce Business Process

**Experience:**

* 2-5 years of experience in the domains mentioned in the Job Description above
* Experience of Sales/Service/Digital Interaction Cloud implementation would be beneficial.

**Education:**

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Management Information Systems or Masters in Computer Applications. Post-graduate certification like CA/MBA etc. Would be an added bonus.

title: Network Administrator
description:
**Job Profile: System and Network Administrator**

Location: Vashi, Navi Mumbai

Qualification: Any Graduate

Experience : Minimum 6 Years Relevant experience.

Salary: As per Industry and Experience.

Contract Term-up: Minimum 2 Year

**Share CV: sunilkumar@opelox.com / HR@opelox.com**

**Contact No. : 9892955033 / 7977264761**

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Server Administration**

1. Server Deployment and Configuration:

* Deploy, configure, and maintain server hardware, operating systems, and associated

software.

* Install and update server software, patches, and security updates as necessary.
* Set up and manage virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V) if applicable.

2. System Monitoring and Performance Optimization:

* Monitor server performance, resource utilization, and network connectivity to identify and resolve issues promptly.
* Conduct system performance tuning and optimization to ensure efficient operation and

response times.

* Implement load balancing and failover mechanisms for high availability and reliability.

3. Security and Data Protection:

* Implement and maintain robust security measures to safeguard servers and data from

unauthorized access, viruses, and malware.

* Create and enforce server access controls, user accounts, and permissions.
* Conduct regular backups and ensure data integrity to prevent data loss.

4. Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution:

* Respond to server-related incidents and problems, troubleshoot root causes, and resolve

issues within defined service level agreements (SLAs).

* Collaborate with other IT teams to diagnose and address complex technical problems.

5. Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity:

* Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and procedures for server systems.
* Participate in disaster recovery drills and testing to validate the effectiveness of recovery

plans.

6. Documentation and Reporting:

* Maintain comprehensive documentation of server configurations, changes, and procedures.
* Generate regular reports on server performance, capacity, and incidents for management

review.

7. Automation and Scripting:

* Leverage automation tools and scripting languages to streamline repetitive tasks and

improve efficiency.

8. System Upgrades and Technology Evaluation:

* Plan and execute server hardware and software upgrades as necessary to keep systems up-to-date.
* Evaluate new server technologies and make recommendations for their implementation.

9. Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:

* Collaborate with IT teams and stakeholders to understand business needs and align server systems accordingly.
* Share knowledge and provide training to other team members when necessary.

**Network Administration**

1. Network Infrastructure Management:

* Design, configure, and maintain the organization's local area network (LAN) and wide area

network (WAN).

* Install, configure, and manage network devices, including routers, switches, firewalls, and

access points.

* Monitor network performance, availability, and security to proactively identify and resolve

issues.

2. Network Security:

* Implement and enforce security policies, protocols, and procedures to protect the

organization's network and data.

* Configure and manage firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and

virtual private networks (VPNs).

* Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments to identify and remediate

potential weaknesses.

3. Access Control and Authentication:

* Set up and manage user access controls and authentication mechanisms to ensure proper

data protection.

* Maintain and regularly review user accounts, permissions, and access rights.

4. Incident Response and Threat Management:

* Monitor network traffic and security alerts for signs of potential security breaches or

unauthorized access.

* Respond to security incidents, conduct forensic analysis, and take appropriate actions to

mitigate risks.

* Stay informed about the latest security threats and vulnerabilities to proactively protect the network.

5. Network Performance Optimization:

* Analyse network traffic patterns and optimize network performance and efficiency.
* Implement Quality of Service (QoS) policies to prioritize critical network traffic.

6. Network Backup and Recovery:

* Establish and maintain network backup and recovery processes to ensure data continuity.
* Conduct regular backup tests and validate data integrity.

7. Network Documentation and Reporting:

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of the network infrastructure,

configurations, and security procedures.

* Generate reports on network performance, security incidents, and compliance status.

8. Vendor Management:

* Collaborate with vendors to procure network and security-related products and services.
* Manage vendor relationships and contracts effectively.

9. Training and User Support:

* Provide training and support to end-users on network access and security best practices.
* Assist users in resolving network connectivity and security-related issues.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From ₹18,000.00 per month

Experience:

* total work: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

**Speak with the employer**  
+91 9892955033

title: Software Engineer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

We have an exciting and rewarding opportunity for you to take your software engineering career to the next level.


As a Software Engineer III at JPMorgan Chase within the Infrastructure Platforms team, you serve as a seasoned member of an agile team to design and deliver trusted market-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. You are responsible for carrying out critical technology solutions across multiple technical areas within various business functions in support of the firm’s business objectives.




**Job responsibilities**




* Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting with ability to think beyond routine or conventional approaches to build solutions or break down technical problems
* Creates secure and high-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems
* Produces architecture and design artifacts for complex applications while being accountable for ensuring design constraints are met by software code development
* Gathers, analyzes, synthesizes, and develops visualizations and reporting from large, diverse data sets in service of continuous improvement of software applications and systems
* Proactively identifies hidden problems and patterns in data and uses these insights to drive improvements to coding hygiene and system architecture
* Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies
* Adds to team culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect




**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**




* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 3+ years applied experience
* Hands-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
* Proficient in coding in one or more languages in JavaScript ,HTML, CSS, Glide APIs
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
* Overall knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle
* Solid understanding of agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Applicant Resiliency, and Security
* Demonstrated knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
* Hands-on experience in implementation and customization of minimum two ServiceNow Modules
* Expertise in creating custom Business rules, Client-Scripts, Script Includes, ACL's, Email Notifications, Complex flows using both Workflows and Flow Designers
* Has experience working on System Integrations with ServiceNow and other Third Party tools using REST Methods
* Certified System Administrator and Certified Implementation Specialist in any ServiceNow Module




**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**




* Familiarity with modern front-end technologies
* Exposure to cloud technologies




**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.  

  

High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
**Job Profile**  

**Senior Systems Administrator**  

  

**Location - WFH**  

  

**Department(s):** IT  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

The Senior Systems Administrator is responsible for the implementation and documentation of all enterprise systems solutions as they relate to current and future business needs, as the enterprise has become highly dependent upon its systems architecture. The Systems Engineer is expected to ensure compatibility and scalability with current systems. It is the job of the Systems Engineer to implement and build reliable back-end systems for internal and client needs. Performs other duties as assigned.  

  

**Typical Qualifications**: (education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities typically needed to perform this job)  

  

Education (if beyond High School or equivalent):
  

College graduate with a degree in BS or BA in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field is required.  

* 

  

  

Experience Target (in this job or a related function/field):
  

* Good experience with ADFS(Active Directory Federation Services)

3-8 years of experience in systems administration or a related field is required. A background in Windows Server Infrastructure and VMWare is necessary. Knowledge in Linux and Backup Software is a plus but not required.  
* 

  

  

Skills: (identify essential skills required, and identify additional skills that enable success in performing this job)  

* Administer, implement, and document all enterprise systems solutions.
  

  

  

Knowledge/Abilities: (describe type and level of knowledge or ability needed to perform essential job functions and those that enable success in performing this job)  

* Provides support in maintaining, troubleshooting, and upgrading the core server infrastructure. This includes core domain controllers, systems drawing/documentation, maintain current designs.
* Ability to keep current systems patched and complaint with Foundever Security standards
* Ability to keep and maintain datacenter service levels and performance.
* Ability to keep and maintain server systems in service levels and performance.
* Ability to acquire information and learn the latest items as technology updates/evolve.
* Participate in an Emergency On-Call Rotation for after-hours and weekend support.
* Flexible schedules and 24x7 support availability (scheduled in advance) may be required as necessary to support the technical needs of our customers

  

Special Certifications:  

**Microsoft Certified: Windows Server Hybrid Administrator Associate or VCP (VMWare Certified Professional) is necessary.**  

  

**Our Perks**  

* Competitive salaries, benefits, paid time off.
* Onsite and remote work at home available (depending on the market).
* Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our SitelFit wellness program.
* Growth opportunities through various development programs.
* Employee discounts.
* Casual dress code.
* Excellent work culture.

  

**Join the #SitelLife**  

  

**GAIN STABILITY, EXPAND POSSIBILITIES.** We celebrate successes and reward our people for their hard work every day. We offer benefits to keep you healthy and happy, such as paid time off. Plus, fun perks like employee discounts.
  

  

**GROW AS YOU GO.** We invest in you with internal programs, training, and initiatives to develop your skills and help you reach your goals. We promote from within. We provide you with the tools, skills, and resources to develop professionally and personally. You choose where you want to go; we help you get there.
  

  

**WORK TOGETHER TO MAKE AN IMPACT.** We strive to make the world a better place and empower others to do the same. We are mission-driven -and we leverage the power of our people to make a positive impact in the communities in which we live and work.
  

  

**BE BOLD, BE YOU.** #SitelLife represents our commitment to our people - to YOU. It's about coming exactly as you are. We empower everyone to live their truth, be themselves and use their voice -and we give them a platform to do so.
  

  

**MAXIMIZE YOUR EXPERIENCE.** We value open, honest, and constructive conversation. We encourage you to speak up -and we listen when you do. Through MAX, our global community, we leverage our people's innovative ideas, experiences, and feedback to shape and drive the future of Sitel Group®.
  

  

Our talent is our strategic differentiator. By bringing together diverse perspectives through our people and ideas, we foster an environment where people belong, all voices are heard, and everyone is vital and can contribute their best work. Sitel Group® is proud to be an Equal Opportunity workplace.

title: Database Administrator
description:
**Project Role :** Database Administrator  

**Project Role Description :** Administer, develop, test, or demonstrate databases. Perform many related database functions across one or more teams or clients, including designing, implementing and maintaining new databases, backup/recovery and configuration management. Install database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance.
  

**Must have skills :** Red Hat OS Administration  

**Good to have skills :** NA  

Minimum **3** year(s) of experience is required  

**Educational Qualification :** BE  

  

Summary: As a Database Administrator, you will be responsible for administering, developing, testing, or demonstrating databases. Your typical day will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining new databases, performing backup/recovery, and configuration management. Roles & Responsibilities: - Install and configure database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance. - Perform database maintenance activities such as backups, restores, and recovery. - Design, implement, and maintain new databases, including creating database schemas, tables, and indexes. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues. - Develop and maintain database documentation, including data standards, procedures, and definitions. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must To Have Skills: Strong experience in Red Hat OS Administration. - Good To Have Skills: Experience with other database management systems such as Oracle, MySQL, or SQL Server. - Experience in database backup and recovery procedures. - Experience in database performance tuning and optimization. - Experience in database security and access control. - Experience in database replication and clustering technologies. Additional Information: - The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Red Hat OS Administration. - The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful database solutions. - This position is based at our Pune office.


  

BE

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
**Position Type :**

Full time**Type Of Hire :**

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)**Education Desired :**

Bachelor of Information Technology**Travel Percentage :**

0%**Job Description**


Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.

**About the team**

  

It’s an amazing opportunity to join a Talented team of innovative and committed folks doing interesting work at the world’s largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions!


**What you will be doing**

* 5-8 yrs experience working in a Systems administration (Linux/Solaris or AIX)
* Works with Line Of Business representatives to ensure remediation efforts adhere to corporate policies
* Providing support to security practices and implementations of concepts across complex environments
* Generate reports on assessment findings/patch compliance and summarize information to facilitate remediation tasks
* Perform policy compliance scans and deliver reports to the technology owners
* Plan, develop, and execute vulnerability scans of organization information systems
* Identify and resolve false positive findings in assessment results
* Respond to & manage remediation of prioritized vulnerabilities and unpatched systems
* Willing to work in weekend & shifts if needed
* Manages enterprise vulnerability assessments and configuration patch and vulnerability scanning tools
* Work closely with Security Awareness contact to socialize awareness of new vulnerabilities and threats by leveraging threat alerting services and industry research
* Perform vulnerability testing, risk analysis and security assessments
* Excellent oral and written communication skills – must be comfortable communicating with customers, management as well as technical peers
* Ensure Quality of deliverables
* Should be flexible to work in shifts, predominantly UK OR US shifts

**What you bring:**

* Education - Bachelor or higher degree
* 5-8 years’ experience in working in IT services organization
* Good skills on MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Hands on experience in supporting Unix Servers
* Oversight of the vulnerability management process
* Awareness in SVM (Security Vulnerability Management) team for vulnerability fixes

**What we offer you**

* A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
* A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
* A competitive salary and benefits
* A variety of career development tools, resources and opportunities

**Privacy Statement**


FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

**Sourcing Model**


Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

title: Support Practitioner
description:
**Project Role :** Infra Tech Support Practitioner  

**Project Role Description :** Provide ongoing technical support and maintenance of production and development systems and software products (both remote and onsite) and for configured services running on various platforms (operating within a defined operating model and processes). Provide hardware/software support and implement technology at the operating system-level across all server and network areas, and for particular software solutions/vendors/brands. Work includes L1 and L2/ basic and intermediate level troubleshooting.
  

**Must have skills :** IBM AS /400 Administration  

**Good to have skills :** NA  

Minimum **3** year(s) of experience is required  

**Educational Qualification :** Graduate  

  

Summary: As an Infra Tech Support Practitioner, you will be responsible for providing ongoing technical support and maintenance of production and development systems and software products. Your typical day will involve troubleshooting and resolving hardware/software issues and implementing technology at the operating system-level across all server and network areas. Role: AS400 or IBM Admin. Roles & Responsibilities: - Provide ongoing technical support and maintenance of production and development systems and software products, both remote and onsite. - Troubleshoot and resolve hardware/software issues at L1 and L2/basic and intermediate level. - Implement technology at the operating system-level across all server and network areas. - Provide hardware/software support and implement technology for particular software solutions/vendors/brands. - Work within a defined operating model and processes. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must Have Skills: Experience in IBM AS/400 Administration. - Good To Have Skills: Knowledge of other operating systems such as Windows, Linux, and Unix. - Minimum 4-6 years of experience supporting IBM i systems as administrator. - Experience in AS400 Security Management, Communications, Operating System Upgrades, PTF deployment and Storage Based Replication. - Experience with BRMS Backup and restore process. - Has participated in one major operating system upgrade. - Participated in DR drills/DR Tests. - Experience in PowerHA/Mimix HA tools. - Experience with HMC and Firmware upgrade. - Rich experience in troubleshooting performance issues. Additional Information: - Willingness to work in Shifts and good communication skills.


  

Graduate
